0.title: 16 COVID-19 deaths reported in last 3 weeks in Thane
0.article_body: About 16 people succumbed to COVID-19 in last three weeks in Maharashtra's Thane. According to Thane's health department, all deceased were aged between 58-60 years and had co-morbidities. However, officials added that the number of infections reduced from around 200-300 per day in August to around 100-180 cases in September, with 50-70 cases being reported daily over last three days.

1.title: Telecom dept director, engineer arrested in Pune over bribery charges
1.article_body: CBI arrested the director and an assistant divisional engineer of the Telecommunication Department of the Ministry of Communications, posted in Pune, while they were accepting a bribe. The two officers work in the office of Advisor, Maharashtra Licensed Service Area. Searches were conducted at the residential and office premises of both the accused, officials said.

2.title: Encroachments near Bengaluru's Greenwood Residency demolished by BBMP
2.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) demolished illegal constructions near Greenwood Residency in Sarjapur as the civic body continued its anti-encroachment drive in Mahadevapura zone. BBMP also removed an RCC bridge (reinforced cement concrete) that was built on a drain channel in Kasavanahalli's Valliyamma layout. Several sheds built on drains in Kasavanahalli were also demolished.

3.title: NIA launches 'largest-ever' searches across India against groups backing terror activities
3.article_body: The NIA on Thursday launched a massive nationwide search operation against groups, including PFI, and individuals allegedly supporting terrorists, officials said. In the "largest ever investigation till date", the searches are taking place at the premises of those allegedly involved in terror funding, organising training camps, and radicalising people to join proscribed organisations, they said.

4.title: Mumbai auto, taxi drivers to go on strike from Sept 26 over fare hike
4.article_body: The auto-rickshaw and taxi unions in Mumbai have decided to go on a strike from September 26 over their demand for an increase in fares. They have postponed the strike twice before, following assurances from the state government in the matter. The taxi union has demanded the minimum fare for 1.5 km to be raised from ₹25 to ₹35.

5.title: Gauri Khan speaks on son Aryan's arrest for the 1st time, says 'Nothing can be worse'
5.article_body: During her appearance on Koffee with Karan, Gauri Khan spoke for the first time about son Aryan's arrest last year. "Nothing can be worse than what we've just been through. But where we all stand as a family, I can say that we are in a great space," she said. "We are grateful to everyone who helped us," she added.

6.title: Flying car company backed by Google Co-founder Larry Page to shut down
6.article_body: Kittyhawk, the air-taxi company backed by billionaire Google Co-founder Larry Page, is closing down. In a LinkedIn post, the company said, "We've made the decision to wind down Kittyhawk. We're still working on the details of what’s next." Kittyhawk was founded in 2010 by Sebastian Thrun and had unveiled a demonstration video of a flying car in 2017.

7.title: Truck driver who mowed down 4 in Delhi held from UP, vehicle seized
7.article_body: The truck driver, who mowed down four persons and injured two others in Delhi's Seemapuri, was arrested from Uttar Pradesh's Shamli, police said. The vehicle has also been seized, police added. The driver was driving rashly and negligently, DCP (Shahdara) R Sathiyasundaram said. The accident took place at 1:51 am on Wednesday, following which two persons died on the spot.

8.title: Conspiracy to defame me: K'taka CM as 'PayCM' posters surface in B'luru
8.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said there is a conspiracy to defame him and damage Karnataka's image, as posters cropped up in Bengaluru with the caption 'PayCM' and a QR code with Bommai's photo on it. BJP leaders in the state have been accused of taking 40% of the contract amount as bribe from contractors for all state-sponsored infrastructural works.

9.title: 2 minors kill man for refusing to give ₹200 for gambling in Delhi
9.article_body: Two minors, aged 13 and 15, have been nabbed by the police for allegedly killing a man who refused to give them ₹200 for gambling in Delhi's Patel Nagar, police said on Wednesday. The accused killed him with a knife, iron rods and bricks when he resisted the robbery bid, police said, adding that another accused is still at large.

10.title: Bengaluru's Cubbon Park planning to ban eatables inside park premises
10.article_body: Authorities of Bengaluru's Cubbon Park are planning to ban eatables within the park and have instructed guards to ensure that no food items are taken inside the park's premises. "Our issue is with those who carry disposable parcels inside the park and dump leftovers...We're fine with visitors bringing well-packed lunch boxes from home," the park's Deputy Director HT Balakrishna said.

11.title: Hospital guards assault 2 youths over parking dispute in Noida, video surfaces
11.article_body: Following a parking dispute, guards of Noida's Yatharth Super Speciality Hospital allegedly assaulted two youths with iron rods. The entire incident was caught on a CCTV camera and has now gone viral on social media. According to reports, the guards asked the victims to not park their car outside the hospital, which sparked a fight.

12.title: 2 workers killed, 4 injured as railway wall collapses on them in Thane
12.article_body: At least two workers were killed and four others were injured after a wall in Thane's Dombivli railway station collapsed on Wednesday evening. While the workers were building a new protection wall to prevent encroachments on station premises, the old wall collapsed on them. The six workers were pulled out from under the debris by other workers and local residents.

13.title: Pedestrian dies after NMMC garbage vehicle hits him in Mumbai
13.article_body: A 61-year-old pedestrian died after a garbage vehicle of Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) reportedly hit him on Sunday near Turbhe Naka. The driver of the vehicle allegedly lost control, hitting the deceased as well as a parked car. The police have registered a case against the 45-year-old driver and detained him. The car was also damaged in the incident.

14.title: 5 celebrate birthday on road in Ghaziabad, beat commuters; arrested
14.article_body: Police have arrested five men for celebrating a birthday party on the road in Ghaziabad. According to a police official, the accused stopped commuters and distributed cake. Furthermore, the accused also abused and beat passengers after stopping them. Sub-inspector Sandeep Kumar said that their ruckus created a long jam on the elevated road.

15.title: Arms dealer arrested with 15 pistols & 45 live cartridges in Delhi
15.article_body: Police have arrested a 32-year-old alleged arms supplier with 15 high-quality semi-automatic pistols and 45 live cartridges in Delhi. The arms were meant to be supplied to gangsters in Delhi and Uttar Pradesh, police said. During interrogation, the accused revealed he used to procure firearms from local manufacturers in Uttar Pradesh's Kairana and would sell them in Baghpat and Shamli.

16.title: US Federal Reserve hikes interest rates by 0.75% for the 3rd time in a row
16.article_body: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its benchmark interest rate by 0.75% for the third straight time. The move will raise its key rate to a range of 3.00% to 3.25%, the highest since 2008. US stock indexes rose on Wednesday ahead of the rate hike announcement by the US Federal Reserve System.

17.title: TRS leaders beat toll plaza staff after row over fee in Telangana
17.article_body: TRS leaders thrashed a toll plaza employee on Wednesday in Telangana after a party leader, who's the Sarpanch from Nasurullabad, was asked to pay toll fee. A CCTV footage showed few people getting out of a car and thrashing the employee before more people entered the scene. The plaza was also vandalised. Police have registered a case against both parties.

18.title: YouTuber & motorist TTF Vasan booked for rash driving in Coimbatore
18.article_body: Days after uploading a video of his ride on social media, YouTuber and motorist TTF Vasan was booked for rash and dangerous driving in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore, police said. Vasan had gone on a ride with influencer GP Muthu on Palakkad Main Road and drove his motorcycle at a very high speed causing a threat to people, officials said.

19.title: EAM Jaishankar informs Ukrainian PM of India's position in war
19.article_body: EAM S Jaishankar met Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal on Wednesday at the UN headquarters and told him that India hopes for "cessation of all hostilities" in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. "Discussed their (the war's) consequences, including for food security, energy security and safety of nuclear facilities," Jaishankar tweeted. The leaders met on the sidelines of a UN General Assembly session.

20.title: Rain killed over 550 children in Pak this year: UNICEF official
20.article_body: Rains and floods have killed over 550 children in Pakistan this year and without a surge in aid more children will die, UNICEF, Pakistan official Gerida Birukila said. She added the floods had displaced 3.4 million children. "The world needs to come together and help the children in Pakistan. Together we can save lives," she said.

21.title: England announce schedule for Ashes 2023
21.article_body: The men's Ashes next year will be contested between June 16 to July 31, with Edgbaston, Lord's, Headingley, Old Trafford and The Oval set to host the Tests, the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) announced. The first Test will begin on June 16 at Edgbaston, while the last Test will take place at The Oval starting July 27.

22.title: Where is brilliance, where is the X-factor: Ravi Shastri on Team India's fielding
22.article_body: Talking about India's fielding in the first T20I against Australia, Ravi Shastri said, "Where is brilliance? Where is that X-factor?" He added, "If you look at all the top Indian teams over the years, there is youth and experience. I find the youth missing here and hence the fielding." Australia defeated India in the first T20I by 4 wickets.

23.title: Mamata ready to bury differences with Cong to form anti-BJP front: Pawar
23.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is ready to bury her differences with Congress and come together to form an alliance of opposition parties against the BJP ahead of 2024 polls. "The rank and file of...TMC was highly disappointed with the Congress after the West Bengal elections, but the party chief amended her stand," Pawar added.

24.title: Nepal President refuses to approve amendments to citizenship law
24.article_body: Nepalese President Bidya Devi Bhandari has refused to approve amendments to the country's citizenship law, which seek to give citizenship certificates to children whose parents' whereabouts are unknown. The deadline for Bhandari to sign the bill was Tuesday midnight. The bill has been passed by the Parliament twice, after Bhandari once earlier had sent it back.

25.title: MSME bad loans for banks may rise to 11% by March 2024: Crisil
25.article_body: Crisil Ratings stated that gross NPAs (GNPA) in the MSME segment may rise to around 10-11% by March 2024. It added that the MSME segment saw a restructuring at around 6%, and about a fourth of these accounts could potentially slip into NPAs. GNPA in the MSME segment was approximately 9.3% as on March 31, 2022.

26.title: Chargesheet filed against Teesta Setalvad, 2 others for false evidence
26.article_body: A Special Investigation Team (SIT) filed a chargesheet against activist Teesta Setalvad, retired Director General of Police R B Sreekumar and dismissed IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt for allegedly 'fabricating evidence' in the 2002 Gujarat riots case. The chargesheet is 6,300 pages and cites 90 witnesses. Teesta Setalvad, arrested on June 26, was released on interim bail on September 2.

27.title: Amanatullah's aide arrested in T'gana after pistol found at premises
27.article_body: The Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested Aam Aadmi Party MLA Amanatullah Khan's close aide Kaushar Imam Siddique under the Arms Act in Telangana. The 47-year-old was wanted after a country-made pistol and three live rounds were found at his premises. Khan's another aide, Hamid Ali, has also been arrested. Khan is an accused in the Delhi Waqf Board corruption case.

28.title: India's mineral production falls 3.3% in July 2022
28.article_body: According to provisional data by the government, the country's mineral production declined by 3.3% in July 2022 compared to the same month in the previous year. The cumulative year-on-year growth during the April-July period of the ongoing fiscal stood at 6.1%. The important minerals which showed positive growth in July 2022 were phosphorite, coal, copper concentrate, and zinc concentrate.

29.title: Telangana govt to distribute 1 cr Bathukamma sarees from tomorrow
29.article_body: The Telangana government has announced that the annual distribution of Bathukamma sarees to women in the state will begin tomorrow (Thursday). The government will distribute nearly one crore sarees this year. Telangana Textiles and Handlooms Minister KT Rama Rao said the initiative was first launched in 2017 to support weavers amid unemployment and to present a small gift to women.

30.title: US' 'One China' policy remains unchanged: White House
30.article_body: US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan has said there is no change in the US' 'One China' policy and it is "against unilateral changes to the status quo". Sullivan's remarks come after President Joe Biden earlier said the US would defend Taiwan in the event of an invasion. Under the "One China" policy, Taiwan is a part of China.

31.title: Danish queen COVID +ve after attending Queen Elizabeth's funeral
31.article_body: Danish Queen Margrethe II has tested positive for COVID-19 after she attended British Queen Elizabeth II’s funeral, the palace said on Wednesday. Eighty-two-year-old Margrethe tested positive on Tuesday night and her official duties have been cancelled. Margrethe, who has received three doses of the coronavirus vaccine, had also tested COVID-19 positive in February this year.

32.title: Shakira breaks silence on separation from Gerard Piqué, calls it 'incredibly difficult'
32.article_body: Shakira described her breakup from Gerard Piqué as "incredibly difficult" in her first comments since the couple of 11 years parted ways. "It's hard to talk about it, especially because I'm still going through it...and because our separation is not like a regular separation," she stated. Shakira said she has tried to conceal the situation in front of her children.

33.title: You tell me, I don't know: Pandya after reporter asks him about turning point in 1st T20I
33.article_body: On being asked about what the turning point was in the first T20I against Australia, Hardik Pandya sarcastically responded to the reporter, saying, "You tell me, I don't know." He added, "If we knew, we would have stopped it in the field." He further said, "There are still two matches in the series, so we will make a come back."

34.title: Israeli PM, Turkish Prez meet for 1st time in 14 years
34.article_body: The Prime Minister of Israel and the President of Turkey have met for the first time in 14 years in New York on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly. During the meeting with Turkey's Recep Tayyip Erdogan, Israel's Yair Lapid “commended” the recent process to restore full diplomatic ties. Israel and Turkey had earlier differed over the Palestine issue.

35.title: Indian exports to Gulf countries grew by 44% in 2021-22: FIEO
35.article_body: The Federation of Indian Export Organisations (FIEO) reported that India's exports to six Gulf Cooperation Council countries grew by 44% to about $43.9 billion in 2021-22. UAE led the trade with exports worth $28 billion, showing a 68% growth compared to the previous fiscal year. India has a 16% market share in GCC and is targeting 25% by 2027.

36.title: India Women squad for T20 Asia Cup 2022 announced
36.article_body: The BCCI on Wednesday announced the India Women squad for the T20 Asia Cup 2022. Jemimah Rodrigues, who recovered from an injury recently, has returned to the squad. The squad also includes Richa Ghosh, KP Navgire, Dayalan Hemalatha and Sabbineni Meghana among others. The tournament will be held in Bangladesh from October 1 to 15.

37.title: Won't take any sides in Congress president polls: Sonia Gandhi
37.article_body: Congress Interim Chief Sonia Gandhi after meeting Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said she'll not take any sides in upcoming election for the next party president. As per reports, she conveyed the same to Congress MP Shashi Tharoor when he met her two days ago. Party leader Jairam Ramesh earlier said nobody needs anybody's nod to contest the polls.

38.title: TikTok bans US political accounts from fundraising, campaigning
38.article_body: ByteDance-owned TikTok will require accounts of the US government, politicians and political parties to be verified ahead of the US midterm elections in November. Calling itself an entertainment platform, TikTok, in a blog post, also said political accounts will be barred from accessing advertising features. Features like digital payments and gifting will also not be accessible to these accounts.

39.title: 'Brahmāstra' served as one tight slap to the boycott gang: Trade analyst
39.article_body: Trade analyst Atul Mohan said Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Brahmāstra' has done well at the box office. "The industry has come out of the negativity...'Brahmāstra' served as one tight slap to [the boycott gang]," he added. Taran Adarsh stated the comparisons in the box office collection of 'The Kashmir Files' and 'Brahmāstra' aren't correct due to the difference in the budget.

40.title: Software firm [24]7.ai to add 9,000 employees across India in FY23
40.article_body: Global customer service software and services company [24]7.ai has said that it's planning to add 9,000 new employees to its workforce in 2022-23 from all over India. With the work from anywhere options, [24]7.ai said it'd be hiring across voice and chat processes to serve its international client base. The company said it'd hired 5,000 people from India last year.

41.title: 3 new species of snakes discovered in graves & churches in Ecuador
41.article_body: Three new species of underground snakes hidden under graveyards and churches in Ecuador have been discovered by scientists. These snakes are small, cylindrical and archaic-looking and belong to the genus Atractus. Though it's the most species-rich snake genus in the world, these snakes are lesser known as they remain hidden throughout most of their lives owing to their shy nature.

42.title: 46-yr-old woman Maoist leader surrenders before T'gana police
42.article_body: Senior Maoist leader Madavi Hademe alias Savitri, the Divisional Committee Member of South Bastar Division, surrendered before Telangana Police on Wednesday. The 46-year-old participated in five attacks on security forces and four ambushes during her underground life, a press release stated. She was frustrated with "mindless violence and aimless protracted armed struggle of CPI(Maoist)", it said.

43.title: 'Thackeray' movie was made with Sanjay Raut's black money: ED witness
43.article_body: Swapna Patkar, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's former aide and the ED's prime witness in the Patra Chawl case, has alleged that Raut's family-owned entity produced the film 'Thackeray' with his unaccounted money. "Apart from investing unaccounted money in the above-mentioned projects, [Raut] nowadays started routing his unaccounted money through various shell companies," Patkar added.

44.title: Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly passes 9 bills by voice vote
44.article_body: The Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly on Wednesday passed nine bills, including Andhra Pradesh Labour Welfare Fund (Second Amendment) Bill 2022 and Andhra Pradesh Shops and Establishments (Amendment) Bill 2022. The House also passed Urban Development Authorities (Amendment) Bill 2022 and Andhra Pradesh Municipal Laws (Amendment) Bill 2022. Notably, all bills were passed by voice vote.

45.title: Will worship Ambedkar now: K'taka Dalit family fined ₹60,000 for touching idol
45.article_body: A 15-year-old Dalit boy touched a pole during a religious procession in a village in Karnataka, following which his family was asked to pay a fine of ₹60,000. "We will offer our prayers to Dr BR Ambedkar," said Shobamma, the 15-year-old boy's mother. What's the point of offering prayers if God doesn't like our touch? she asked.

46.title: Kuku FM raises $21.8 mn in round led by Nandan Nilekani's Fundamentum
46.article_body: Audio content platform Kuku FM has raised $21.8 million in its Series B1 funding round which was led by Nandan Nilekani-backed Fundamentum Partnership. As part of this investment, Prateek Jain, a Principal at Fundamentum, will join Kuku's board. Kuku was founded in 2018 by Lal Chand Bisu, Vikas Goyal and Vinod Kumar Meena and currently has 1.6 million paid subscribers.

47.title: Hotter climate may lead to increase in kidney stone disease: Study
47.article_body: Rising temperature due to climate crisis could lead to an increase in kidney stone disease, a study stated. Researchers said cases of kidney stones have increased in the last 20 years, mostly in women and adolescents. They also found a sharp rise in patients with the condition following hotter days in the US, indicating impact of climate change on health.

48.title: Raju Srivastava's career was like a rollercoaster: Aasif Sheikh
48.article_body: Actor Aasif Sheikh has said that late comedian Raju Srivastava's career was like a rollercoaster. "He had no work and then 'The Great Indian Laughter Challenge' happened and he became a star and how! He was a positive person even during bad times," Aasif added. He added that Raju was a game changer in comedy.

49.title: Not about collection: FFI committee head on not picking RRR for Oscars
49.article_body: Film Federation of India (FFI) committee head TS Nagabharana has said that the idea behind picking 'Chhello Show (Last Film Show)' for Oscars was to have a film which represents India in a different way. Speaking about people's reaction to 'RRR' or 'The Kashmir Files' not being picked, he said, "The story matters not the collection or popularity."

50.title: Edtech startup Bhanzu raises $15 mn in Series A funding round
50.article_body: Edtech startup Bhanzu raised $15 million in a Series A funding round led by Eight Roads Ventures and Facebook co-founder's VC firm B Capital. Bhanzu reportedly raised the funds at a valuation of $105 million. The math learning platform was founded in 2020 by Neelakantha Bhanu, who holds four world records for being the Fastest Human Calculator in the World.

51.title: India Women record their highest-ever ODI total on England soil
51.article_body: India Women on Wednesday recorded their highest-ever ODI total on England soil by registering 333/5 in their 50 overs in second ODI at St Lawrence Ground in Canterbury. India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur top-scored with 143*(111), including 18 fours and four sixes. India Women's previous highest ODI total on England soil was 281/3, registered on June 24, 2017 in Derby.

52.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
52.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy rainfall warning for several states till September 25. Heavy rainfall is likely over parts of Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh till September 25. It's very likely over Arunachal Pradesh till September 24. Further, it is likely over Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan and Assam till September 23.

53.title: Rescue Indians held illegally in Myanmar: TN CM writes to PM Modi
53.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Wednesday wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi and requested the immediate rescue and safe repatriation of Indians held in illegal captivity in Myanmar. Stalin stated he has received information that around 300 Indians, including 50 Tamils, are stuck and facing severe hardships. State government is in touch with 17 such Tamils, Stalin stated.

54.title: Jupiter will be its closest to Earth in 59 years on September 26: NASA
54.article_body: On September 26, Jupiter will be its closest to the Earth in the last 59 years, NASA said. On this day, Jupiter will be directly opposite the sun as viewed from Earth, an astronomical arrangement known as opposition, which happens every 13 months. But opposition rarely coincides with Jupiter's closest approach to the Earth, making it a rare event.

55.title: 45 kg poppy seized from Jammu and Kashmir's Samba, 2 arrested
55.article_body: Police seized over 45 kg of poppy from a Punjab-bound bus in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district and arrested two persons in connection with the case, officials said on Wednesday. A police team intercepted the bus on the Jammu-Pathankot national highway at AIIMS checkpoint. The driver and the conductor were then arrested, the officials added.

56.title: Crocodile spotted inside government school in UP's Aligarh
56.article_body: A crocodile was spotted by students in a government school in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh. The school was located in Qasimpur village, and Divisional Forest Officer (DFO) Diwakar Vashisht said that the crocodile was taken and was released into the River Ganga. Villagers claimed that they imprisoned it in a classroom till a State Forest department official came and captured it.

57.title: Eateries in B'luru can't operate 24x7, but will consider plea: CM
57.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that eateries and restaurants in Bengaluru cannot operate 24x7 but a decision may be taken to change the rules in the future. Bommai added that the request would be considered at the earliest. In April, the Bruhat Bengaluru Hotels and Restaurants Association(BBHRA) sought permission to run establishments 24x7.

58.title: Future Enterprises defaults on ₹15.73 cr interest payment for NCDs
58.article_body: Future Enterprises, a part of Future Group, on Wednesday said that it defaulted on an interest payment of ₹15.73 on Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs). The default occurred for the period March 21, 2022, to September 19, 2022 and the gross principal amount on which it occurred is ₹327 crore. The company had earlier defaulted on another interest payment of ₹4.10 crore.

59.title: Kurmi community's 'Rail Roko' protest for ST status continues in WB
59.article_body: The 'Rail Roko' protest in West Bengal by members of the Kurmi community entered its second day on Wednesday. The protesters are demanding for Scheduled Tribe (ST) status and the inclusion of Kurmali language in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution. The protesters blocked railway tracks at stations including Kharagpur, Khemasuli and Purulia, resulting in the cancellation of 53 trains.

60.title: Worked as assistant in Raju Srivastava's film when I was 18: Krushna
60.article_body: Actor-comedian Krushna Abhishek revealed that he began his career as an assistant to director Lawrence D'souza in the film which featured late comedian Raju Srivastava when he was 18 years old. "We went on to do so many television and live shows together. [Raju] was genuinely a nice person, my condolences to the family," he added.

61.title: There is a will to re-engage: French Prez after meeting Liz Truss
61.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron met British PM Liz Truss in New York on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly. After the meeting, Macron said they discussed the Russia-Ukraine war and issues of the European Union. "There is a will to re-engage, to move on and to show that we are allies and friends in a complex world," he said.

62.title: Businesses that can't be audited won't be permitted: SEBI Chief
62.article_body: SEBI Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch said that any business that operates on the 'black box' model that cannot be audited or validated will not be permitted. Amid reports that the market regulator might clamp down on algo trading, Buch said, "We are not for or against algo trading as long as there is sufficient transparency and disclosures".

63.title: Mark Zuckerberg shares pic with wife to announce they're expecting 3rd baby girl
63.article_body: Facebook Co-founder and Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced he and his wife Priscilla Chan Zuckerberg are expecting third baby girl. Sharing a picture with Priscilla on Instagram, Mark wrote, "Lots of love. Happy to share that Max and August are getting a new baby sister next year!" The couple are already parents to two girls aged six and five.

64.title: Man involved in murder of Suresh Raina's relatives arrested in UP
64.article_body: A man involved in murder of Suresh Raina's relatives has been arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar. The suspect had been wanted by police since August 2020, when more than a dozen members of a gang entered the house of Raina's uncle and aunt in Pathankot. Raina's uncle and cousin were killed in the attack.

65.title: Apple may move a quarter of iPhone production to India by 2025: Report
65.article_body: JP Morgan analysts have said that Apple may make one out of four iPhones in India by 2025. The analysts expected that the company could move about 5% of iPhone 14 production from late 2022 to India. This comes as Apple is reportedly moving some production away from China amid mounting geopolitical tensions and strict COVID-19 lockdowns in the nation.

66.title: 'Seeking owner's manzoori'?: BJP on Gehlot, Tharoor meeting Sonia
66.article_body: Responding to reports of Congress leaders Ashok Gehlot and Shashi Tharoor meeting Sonia Gandhi, BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla asked, "In which election does the candidate meet and seek 'manzoori' from the family to contest an election?" Poonawalla said the meetings prove the Congress is not a party but a "family firm or a private limited company".

67.title: Good realisation: BJP as Savarkar's pic appears on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' posters
67.article_body: Sharing photos showing Veer Savarkar's image on a poster for Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', BJP IT Cell chief Amit Malviya said, "Although belated, good realisation for [Congress leader] Rahul Gandhi." "Oops! It seems all attempts by Rahul to obfuscate history didn't work," BJP National Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said. "Later on they tried to cover it up! Savarkar Zindabad," Poonawalla added.

68.title: BJP's Coimbatore district chief arrested for threatening A Raja
68.article_body: The BJP's Coimbatore district chief Balaji Uthamaramasamy was arrested on Wednesday for threatening former Union Minister and DMK leader A Raja. On Monday, Raja had criticised the Hindu concept of 'Sanatana Dharma'. In response, Uthamaramasamy had questioned Raja's knowledge on the subject and challenged him to set foot in Coimbatore without police protection.

69.title: 8.5 lakh trees to be cut as govt approves megaproject in Great Nicobar
69.article_body: Union Environment Ministry's Expert Appraisal Committee has given its nod for the development of a strategically-crucial project in Great Nicobar Island. It will involve felling of around 8.5 lakh trees in pristine rainforests and loss of 12-20 hectares of mangrove cover. The project involves development of a military-civil airport and international container trans-shipment terminal, among others.

70.title: Deeply alarmed by attacks against Hindus in Leicester: VHP writes to UK PM
70.article_body: The VHP on Wednesday wrote to UK Prime Minister Liz Truss seeking action against the "continued violence against Hindus in Leicester and Birmingham by Islamic extremists". In a letter to Truss, VHP said that it is "deeply concerned and alarmed", adding that Hindus are being terrorised to remove symbols of their heritage, tradition, culture and religion.

71.title: Honda overpays bonuses to employees at US plant, asks employees to return money
71.article_body: Honda has asked hundreds of employees at its vehicle plant in US' Ohio to pay back part of their bonuses after claiming that it overpaid them. The Japanese car manufacturer gave employees nine days to return part of their bonus money. "Not a lot of people can handle this kind of a hit," the wife of a Honda employee said.

72.title: Inshorts Co-founder & CEO Azhar Iqubal named 'Entrepreneur of the Year (Media)'
72.article_body: Inshorts Co-founder and CEO Azhar Iqubal has been named 'Entrepreneur of the Year' in the media category at Entrepreneur Awards 2022 organised by Entrepreneur India magazine. The award recognises an entrepreneur who has done phenomenal work in the field of media, the magazine said. Founded in 2013, Inshorts operates 60-word news app Inshorts and location-based social media platform Public.

73.title: NASA's DART captures Jupiter & its 4 moons ahead of crashing into asteroid
73.article_body: NASA's DART spacecraft has captured the image of Jupiter and its four moons. From left to right in the picture, you can see Ganymede, Jupiter, Europa, Io and Callisto. The image was taken when DART was 700 million kilometres away from Jupiter. The spacecraft will be crashing into Dimorphos to test a planetary defence technique on September 26.

74.title: Assam & Mizoram CMs discuss border dispute, decide to form panel
74.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma and Mizoram CM Zoramthanga met in New Delhi on Wednesday to resolve the decades-old border dispute between their states. Later, Sarma said a regional committee will be formed to settle the dispute. The border dispute had taken a violent turn in July last year when six policemen and one civilian had died in clashes.

75.title: Rohan clarifies comment on Raju Srivastava's death, says 'Today isn't about my feelings'
75.article_body: Comedian Rohan Joshi, who was criticised over his comment on Raju Srivastava's death wherein he wrote 'Good riddance', has clarified after some people asked why he deleted the comment. "I deleted it because after a minute of anger I realised today isn't about my personal feelings," he wrote. "Sorry if it hurt and thanks for the perspective," Rohan added.

76.title: Don't open mails, click on links from our 2K Games unit: Take-Two
76.article_body: Take-Two Interactive Software, the parent-company of Rockstar Games, on Wednesday warned users not to open mails or click on links received from its unit 2K Games. Take-Two said a hacker accessed 2K Games' help desk platform and sent a malicious link to certain customers. 2K Games' support portal will remain offline while it continues to address the issue, Take-Two said.

77.title: Gehlot or Tharoor will be 'puppet' in hands of Rahul: BJP on Cong Prez poll
77.article_body: BJP on Monday said whosoever becomes Congress President, whether Ashok Gehlot or Shashi Tharoor, will only be a "puppet" in the hands of Rahul Gandhi, who will be the "main driver". BJP leader Tom Vadakkan also dubbed Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' as "Corruption Jodo Yatra", saying it started with "2G partners" of DMK. The yatra has entered its 14th day.

78.title: We'll make madrasa students ideal citizens, not stone-pelters: UP Minister
78.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Cabinet Minister Dharam Pal Singh on Wednesday said the state government is undertaking surveys of madrasas so that students studying there get a better education. "We'll make these madrasa students ideal citizens, engineers and doctors. We'll not make them stone-pelters," Singh said. "SP, BSP, Congress...fear loss of Muslim vote...BJP doesn't see [Muslims] as a vote bank," he added.

79.title: New technique 'Virtual Autopsy' used for Raju Srivastava's post-mortem, says AIIMS
79.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava's post-mortem has been conducted with a new technique called Virtual Autopsy, said Dr Sudhir Gupta, Head, Department of Forensic Medicine, AIIMS. "It does not require any dissection. The whole process took 15 to 20 minutes, after which the body was handed over to his family," the doctor added. The comedian passed away aged 58.

80.title: Why is Centre a mute spectator?: SC on hate speech incidents on TV channels
80.article_body: The Supreme Court, while hearing a plea regarding incidents of hate speech on TV channels, asked why the Centre is remaining a "mute spectator". "The government should not take an adversarial stand but assist. Why haven't you filed counter?" the SC said. It added that the role of TV anchors is "very critical" in ensuring that hate speech doesn't continue.

81.title: Bill to ban stray cattle's movement in urban areas withdrawn in Guj
81.article_body: The Gujarat Assembly on Wednesday unanimously withdrew a bill that was aimed at prohibiting the movement of stray cattle on roads and public places in urban areas. The bill was passed in April this year. It asked cattle-rearers to obtain a licence to keep them and get them tagged. The bill added that failing this may lead to imprisonment.

82.title: Man climbs transmission tower in Bhilai as wife refuses to return home
82.article_body: A man climbed a high-tension transmission tower in Chhattisgarh's Bhilai on Tuesday after his wife refused to return home from her parents' house. He had reportedly reached his in-laws' house to pick up his wife when they refused to let her go. "The husband became Dharmendra of Sholay," a netizen said. He was brought to the ground after police intervened.

83.title: AAP pivoting itself to power in name of Nirbhaya; they're BJP's B-team: Cong
83.article_body: Congress' National Media Coordinator Radhika Khera on Wednesday alleged that the Delhi government under CM Arvind Kejriwal was pivoting itself to power "in the name of Nirbhaya" and dubbed AAP as BJP's "B-team". Congress leader Sandeep Dikshit said that Kejriwal's 'Delhi model of governance' is "all about publicity and lacks substance". Delhi model is not development-oriented, he added.

84.title: Working to implement common KYC for financial transactions: FM
84.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said the government is working on the implementation of a common know your customer (KYC) process for carrying out various financial transactions across institutions. "We're...working in such a way that once you've given your KYC, it can be applicable at various institutions at various times for various requirements that you may have," she said.

85.title: Hardik Pandya jumps 22 spots in latest rankings for T20I batters
85.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya jumped 22 places in the latest rankings for T20I batters after smashing 71*(30) against Australia in the first T20I in Mohali. Pandya is now ranked 65th with 446 rating points. Further, all-rounder Axar Patel jumped 24 spots to the 33rd position in rankings for T20I bowlers after taking three wickets during the same match.

86.title: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan's custody extended by 5 days in Waqf Board case
86.article_body: A Delhi court on Wednesday extended AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan's police custody for five more days in the Delhi Waqf Board case. The Okhla MLA was sent to four-day police custody on September 17 after raids at his residence. Anti Corruption Branch said Khan had appointed some friends and relatives as employees in Delhi Waqf Board citing urgency and vacancy.

87.title: I've moved on: Agnihotri on Kashmir Files not being India's Oscar entry
87.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri reacted after his film 'The Kashmir Files' wasn't picked as India's official entry to the Oscars 2023. "I wish them all the luck for the future run. I've nothing else to say...Right now, I'm doing another film and I have moved on," he stated. Gujarati film 'Chhello Show (Last Film Show)' was picked as India's Oscars entry.

88.title: Your dislike doesn't mean Karan Johar is murderer: Swara on Sushant's death
88.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker said there's an atmosphere of fear in the film industry. "In the industry...there's this idea of not engaging in controversy," she added. Speaking about Karan Johar being targeted after Sushant Singh Rajput's death, Swara stated, "You can say a lot of things about Karan Johar...can say his films are obnoxious...but your dislike...doesn't mean that he's a murderer."

89.title: Punjab Governor says no to AAP's special session for trust vote on Sept 22
89.article_body: Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit on Wednesday withdrew the AAP government's order calling for a special Assembly session to hold a trust vote on September 22 (Thursday). The governor cited  "absence of specific rules" to do so. CM Bhagwant Mann had called the session to seek a trust vote amid AAP MLAs' claims of 'Operation Lotus' in the state.

90.title: Yasin Malik to appear before court in Rubaiya Sayeed abduction case
90.article_body: Jammu & Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) founder Yasin Malik has been ordered to appear in front of a special court in connection with the 1989 abduction case of Rubaiya Sayeed. Malik is currently serving life imprisonment in Tihar jail in a terror funding case. Rubaiya was abducted in December 1989 and was released in exchange for five militants.

91.title: Man arrested in Hyd for murdering vegetable vendor, stealing gold
91.article_body: Hyderabad Police arrested a man for murdering a vegetable vendor and stealing her gold ornaments. The accused was a labourer and befriended the vegetable vendor a few months ago, and he decided to kill her and steal ornaments to get easy money, the police said. He was arrested in Secunderabad's Trimulgherry area and the gold was recovered from his possession.

92.title: Lumpy skin disease in cattle more serious in Rajasthan: Union Minister
92.article_body: Union Animal Husbandry Minister Sanjeev Balyan on Wednesday said the problem of lumpy skin disease is more serious in Rajasthan and about 12.5 lakh cattle have been affected in the state. At present, about 18.5 lakh cattle are affected across the country. The Centre has provided about 30 lakh vaccine doses against lumpy virus to the Rajasthan government, Balyan added.

93.title: NASA captures clearest view of Neptune's rings in more than 30 years
93.article_body: NASA on Wednesday announced that its James Webb Space Telescope has captured the clearest view of Neptune's rings in more than 30 years. "In addition to several bright, narrow rings, the Webb image clearly shows Neptune’s fainter dust bands," NASA said. The images also captured seven of Neptune's 14 known moons: Galatea, Naiad, Thalassa, Despina, Proteus, Larissa, and Triton.

94.title: Will urge Rahul Gandhi again to become Congress chief: Raj CM Gehlot
94.article_body: Ahead of the Congress party's presidential polls, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said he'll urge Rahul Gandhi again to become the president. "I'm fortunate that Congressmen...have faith, love, and trust in me...if they ask me to file nomination, I'll do so," he said. "If it's up to me, then I will not take any posts...I'll join Rahul Gandhi's yatra," he added.

95.title: Permission of Sonia, Rahul not required to contest Presidential poll: Cong
95.article_body: The Congress on Wednesday said no one requires the permission of party President Sonia Gandhi or its leader Rahul Gandhi to contest in its upcoming Presidential elections. "Anybody is free and welcome to contest in the election if they have the backing of 10 PCC delegates," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said. "The elections will be fair and transparent," Ramesh added.

96.title: FIR registered against Kerala professor named in LPU student's suicide note
96.article_body: A case has been registered against a professor at NIT Calicut after his name surfaced on the suicide note of a first-year student at Lovely Professional University (LPU) in Punjab's Jalandhar. The student was rusticated from NIT after which he joined LPU, police said. "He wrote in the note that he is committing suicide due to the professor," police added.

97.title: SP failed to stop BJP from working against people's interests: BSP chief
97.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Wednesday accused the SP of failing to stop the BJP from working against people's interests. "This has set...BJP government free to work against interests and welfare of crores of people...with a completely autocratic, anti-people thinking and working style," she tweeted. "Even in the Legislative Assembly...SP looks very helpless and weak against the government," she said.

98.title: Govt approves ₹19,500-crore PLI scheme on solar PV modules
98.article_body: The government has approved Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme on 'national programme on high efficiency solar PV modules', with an outlay of ₹19,500 crore. Union Minister Anurag Thakur said the PLI is aimed at achieving manufacturing capacity of Giga Watt (GW) scale in high efficiency solar PV modules. Thakur said the scheme will bring direct investment of around ₹94,000 crore.

99.title: India raises fiscal support for local chip, display manufacturing
99.article_body: Indian government announced increasing fiscal support for new semiconductor facilities to cover 50% of project costs. The government added that it will remove the maximum limit of permitted investment for display manufacturing to boost local production. According to the announcement, the government will also cover 50% of the capital expenditure for setting up semiconductor packaging plants.

100.title: Amazon announces 71 new renewable energy projects
100.article_body: Amazon said it would add 2.7 gigawatts of clean energy capacity through 71 new projects, taking its total of renewable energy projects to 379. The projects include three large-scale plants in Rajasthan, rooftop solar projects in France and Austria, and its first solar farm in Poland. It expects to generate 50,000 gigawatt hours of energy from its entire portfolio.

101.title: Banking sector liquidity in deficit for 1st time in 40 months: RBI
101.article_body: India's banking sector liquidity has slipped into a deficit for the first time in 40 months, data from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) showed. RBI infused ₹21,873 crore into the banking system on Tuesday, the highest since May 2019. The Centre is reportedly in no hurry to push inflation, which is near 7%, back to RBI's 4% medium-term target.

102.title: Rahul Gandhi introduced to K-pop by Kerala's BTS Army, video surfaces
102.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had his first lesson in the Korean music genre K-pop and popular band BTS from a group of schoolgirls in Kerala on Tuesday during Congress' ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. The schoolgirls told Gandhi that they wanted to become nurses and work in South Korea and also played a BTS music video for the Congress leader.

103.title: Serentica Renewables in talks to enter green energy generation
103.article_body: Pratik Agarwal, director of Serentica Renewables, said that the company is in talks to scale up its green energy generation capacity to 1,500 MW. The company recently secured a deal with three Vedanta Group companies to supply 580 MW of green power. Agarwal also said the group is in talks with potential investors for investment across green energy.

104.title: Latest rankings for T20I batters released, Suryakumar Yadav overtakes Babar Azam
104.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday released the latest rankings for T20I batters, with India's Suryakumar Yadav overtaking Pakistan's Babar Azam. Suryakumar is now ranked third with 780 rating points, while Babar is fourth with 771 rating points. Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan leads the rankings with 825 rating points. Suryakumar is the only Indian in the top 10.

105.title: CBI arrests ABG Shipyard founder-chairman Rishi Agarwal in ₹22,842-crore bank fraud case
105.article_body: The CBI arrested the founder-chairman of ABG Shipyard Limited, Rishi Kamlesh Agarwal, in connection with an alleged bank fraud of ₹22,842 crore. The company was sanctioned credit facilities from 28 banks and financial institutions led by ICICI Bank, with SBI having an exposure of ₹2,468.51 crore. Funds were used for purposes other than for which they were released, officials said.

106.title: Protests at Pune university over irregularities in exam results, fees
106.article_body: Yuvak Kranti Dal and Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad held two separate protests at Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) on Tuesday against the irregularities related to semester exam results, fees and facilities. They also demanded the appointment of a full-time Vice-Chancellor at SPPU. Minister Chandrakant Patil has instructed the appointment of a nodal officer to hear students' demands.

107.title: SRK shot for 10 days for his cameo in 'Brahmāstra': Ranbir Kapoor
107.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor revealed that Shah Rukh Khan shot for 10 days for his cameo in 'Brahmāstra'. "We all are actors and when we are asked to do guest appearances, it's usually one day or two days which we agree to do, but...he shot for 10 days," Ranbir stated. Director Ayan Mukerji added that they owe Shah Rukh "a lot".

108.title: DRI seizes 394 foreign-origin gold bars worth ₹33 cr from Mumbai, Delhi
108.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has seized 394 foreign-origin gold bars worth over ₹33 crore from Mumbai, Delhi and Patna, which was smuggled from neighbouring countries, according to a statement issued on Wednesday. Under the 'Op Gold Rush', 120 gold bars were seized from Mumbai, 172 from Bihar and 102 from Delhi.

109.title: Youth trying to stop drug mafia's operations beaten to death in Punjab
109.article_body: A young boy trying to stop a drug smuggler from selling drugs in Punjab's Tarn Taran was allegedly beaten to death by the smuggler's men on Wednesday. The victim's family claims that the youth was kept in confinement for two days and that they also received death threats from the smuggler. Police have identified the accused through the crime's video.

110.title: Class 10 Pune boy selected to participate in NASA-led competition
110.article_body: Sonit Sisolekar, a 15-year-old Class 10 student in Pune has been selected to participate in the Great Lunar Expedition for Everyone (GLEE) 2023, a NASA-led competition. Sisolekar said, "Though volcanology is my primary interest, GLEE has given me an opportunity to read about...volcanic activity on the lunar surface." He's a recipient of the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar of 2021.

111.title: Pretty impressive: Verstappen on Red Bull's in-house engines for 2026
111.article_body: F1 world champion Max Verstappen said his team Red Bull's project to build its power units in-house for the 2026 season is "pretty impressive". "I hear all the stories from Christian (Horner) and Helmut (Marko)...It's pretty impressive what they're doing there at the moment, and what's to come," said Verstappen. Red Bull won the 2021 driver's championship with Honda engines.

112.title: Today, you made me cry for 1st time: Kapil Sharma on Raju Srivastava
112.article_body: Comedian Kapil Sharma took to Instagram and mourned the loss of late comedian Raju Srivastava, who passed away on Wednesday. Kapil shared a picture with Raju and wrote, "Today, for the first time, you made me cry Raju bhai. I wish there would have been one more chance to meet you." Raju passed away at the age of 58.

113.title: JD(U) MLC detained, interrogated by Income Tax Dept at Patna airport
113.article_body: The Income Tax (IT) Department detained JD(U) MLC Dinesh Prasad Singh at Bihar's Patna airport on Tuesday night and interrogated him for three hours. After the interrogation, IT officials were seen leaving the airport with a sealed suitcase. However, Singh said, "They did not find anything, any money, as there was nothing to be found." Singh represents Bihar's Muzaffarpur constituency.

114.title: Raju Srivastava's untimely demise makes me very sad: Ajay Devgn
114.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Twitter and mourned the demise of late comedian Raju Srivastava, who passed away aged 58. "In your lifetime, you gifted us laughs and more laughs, on and off the screen. Your untimely demise makes me very sad," Ajay tweeted. Director Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "There is no such friend or stranger whom Raju didn't make laugh."

115.title: Sonali Phogat had asked for drugs: Aid & murder-accused Sudhir Sangwan
115.article_body: In his confession to the Goa Police, Sonali Phogat's aid and murder accused Sudhir Sangwan said he, along with Sonali and their friend Sukhwinder Singh, "wanted to get high using MDMA drugs" in Goa. He added that after taking MDMA, Phogat's health deteriorated due to an overdose. She vomited, and "her feet were staggering due to intoxication", he added.

116.title: Over 500 property damage cases filed during anti-CAA protests: Delhi Police
116.article_body: The Delhi Police on Wednesday informed the High Court that over 500 cases of property damage were registered during the agitation against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in 2019 and 2020. The police said retired judge Sunil Gaur was appointed the 'claim commissioner' in the related investigations. The court was hearing a petition which sought recovery of the damages.

117.title: Woman straps gold worth ₹15 lakh in sanitary pad, held at B'luru airport
117.article_body: A 26-year-old woman, who was travelling from Thailand to Bengaluru, was held at the Kempegowda International Airport for trying to smuggle gold worth ₹15.4 lakh by strapping it to the sanitary pad she was wearing. The woman was frisked by authorities when she failed to answer a question, following which the gold was found.

118.title: Rats attack road accident victim's dead body kept in mortuary in UP
118.article_body: The body of 21-year-old road accident victim Sumit Gaud, kept in a district hospital mortuary in UP's Gorakhpur, was attacked by rats on Tuesday night. Gaud's family claimed they received his body, which was kept at the mortuary overnight for postmortem, with rat bite marks, including those on his face. Gaud's body was kept in the open, the family claimed.

119.title: Comedian Rohan Joshi criticised for saying 'Good riddance' after Raju Srivastava's death
119.article_body: Comedian Rohan Joshi faced criticism after his remarks on Raju Srivastava's demise. Saying that Srivastava "took every opportunity he ever got to sh*t on newer comics", Joshi wrote in a now-deleted Instagram comment, "Good riddance." "If you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything at all," a person commented, while another comment read, "Shame on the pathetic lowlife."

120.title: Idiot and liar: Musk to US professor who claimed his family owned emerald mine
120.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk on Wednesday called a US professor an "idiot and liar" after he tweeted, "Elon Musk came from a family that owned an emerald mine in Apartheid South Africa." The professor, Robert Reich, also tweeted, "Bill Gates' mom helped Microsoft get a deal with IBM." Through his tweet, Reich called "self-made billionaires" a "myth".

121.title: 'PayCm' posters accusing Bommai of corruption seen across Bengaluru
121.article_body: Posters accusing Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai of corruption were seen pasted across Bengaluru on Wednesday. Titled 'PayCm', the posters featured QR codes which resembled the face of CM Bommai and they bore the tag line 'Scan this QR Code to make the CM PAY for corruption'. Upon scanning, the code redirected to a website called '40% Sarkara'.

122.title: Violation of integrity in its deepest form: Wipro's Premji on staff working for rivals
122.article_body: Rishad Premji, Chairman of IT major Wipro which fired 300 people working directly for one of its competitors, called moonlighting a "complete violation of integrity in its deepest form". He reiterated that there's no space in the company for an employee who also wants to work for a competitor. "I will stand by what I said," Premji said on moonlighting.

123.title: Sanitation workers in B'luru become 'permanent govt employees'
123.article_body: The Karnataka government has decided to give permanent employment status to civic workers in the local bodies, including those under the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike. As many as 11,133 civic workers will be treated as government workers and will get the benefits of public servants. However, the workers' association wants permanent status for all 33,000 sanitation workers across the state.

124.title: Man stabs woman colleague in Thane after she refuses to marry him
124.article_body: A man, Yogesh Kumar, allegedly stabbed a woman colleague in Thane after she refused to marry him, police said on Wednesday. Kumar is absconding, while the 27-year-old woman is undergoing treatment, an official said. The woman, who is already married, suffered injuries in stomach and on the face. She managed to hail an auto-rickshaw and reached a hospital, police added.

125.title: Muslim men accuse MP jail official of forcing them to shave beard
125.article_body: Five Muslim men, lodged in a jail in MP's Rajgarh, have alleged that a jail officer forced them to shave their beards, following which a probe was ordered into the matter. A Congress MLA alleged that these men were abused in the jail, while AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi claimed it was an act of "custodial torture".

126.title: 'Appeasement' politics: Patra on Rahul's pic with hijab-clad girl
126.article_body: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra on Tuesday posted a picture of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi walking hand-in-hand with a hijab-clad girl during the Bharat Jodo Yatra, accusing him of appeasement politics. "When votes are accounted for on the basis of religion…then it's called appeasement," Patra said. Reacting to this, Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said he "didn't even spare the young girl".

127.title: Fintechs need to comply with regulations earlier: Axis Bank CEO
127.article_body: Axis Bank Chief Executive Officer and Managing Director Amitabh Chaudhry said that fintechs have a tendency to do what they want and hope that the regulators won't notice. He stated that has to change and fintechs have to comply with regulations much earlier than they are currently. Further, Chaudhry said that businesses would suffer if they do not pay heed.

128.title: IIT alumni's synthetic speech tech startup Murf AI raises $10 mn
128.article_body: Murf AI, a synthetic speech technology startup, has raised $10 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Matrix Partners India and saw participation from existing investors such as Elevation Capital along with prominent angel investors. Murf was founded in October 2020 by IIT Kharagpur graduates Sneha Roy, Ankur Edkie and Divyanshu Pandey.

129.title: Was judged for attending event after 2 months of giving birth: Neha Dhupia
129.article_body: Neha Dhupia said, as a new mother, she had faced judgements for things as simple as attending an event two months after giving birth. However, she said she has always ignored the judgements and stayed "very unaffected by them". She added that while being a mother is "the most important role" of her life, she goes to work for herself.

130.title: Was praying to see him come out of this: Raju Srivastava's wife
130.article_body: Late comedian Raju Srivastava's wife Shikha Srivastava said she was hopeful about her husband's recovery. She called Raju Srivastava a "true fighter" as he struggled for his life for almost one and a half months. "He fought very hard, I was really hoping and praying to see him come out of this. But, that has not happened," she said.

131.title: 345 kg of heroin worth ₹1,725 cr seized by Delhi Police in Mumbai
131.article_body: The Special Cell of Delhi Police on Wednesday made one of the biggest seizures of heroin from Mumbai and seized heroin worth ₹1,725 crore in the international market, a senior official said. "This seizure indicates how narco terror is impacting our country and international players are using different methodologies to push drugs into our country," said Special CP HGS Dhaliwal.

132.title: Pregnant woman suffers miscarriage after rape by 3 men in Bareilly
132.article_body: A woman suffered a miscarriage after allegedly being raped in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, police said on Wednesday. According to her husband's complaint, the woman, who was three months pregnant, was working on a farm when three men raped her. Police said that the victim has been hospitalised and her condition is critical. One of the accused has been arrested.

133.title: SpiceJet to continue operations at 50% capacity till Oct 29: DGCA
133.article_body: Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Wednesday extended restrictions placed on SpiceJet to operate at 50% capacity till October 29. DGCA noted that the restrictions have been extended "as a matter of abundant caution". Operating capacity shall be increased if SpiceJet showcases it has "sufficient technical support and financial resource to safely" undertake enhanced capacity, DGCA said.

134.title: I lost a friend of 30 years: Ravi Kishan on Raju Srivastava's death
134.article_body: Speaking about Raju Srivastava's death, actor Ravi Kishan said he lost a friend of 30 years. "We both struggled together and we were able to achieve what we had set to achieve," he stated. Ravi revealed that he shared a stage with the late comedian two months ago. Ravi said Raju laid the foundation of Hindi stand-up comedy in India.

135.title: Jignesh Mevani, 14 Congress MLAs suspended from Gujarat Assembly
135.article_body: Gujarat Assembly Speaker Nimaben Acharya on Wednesday suspended Independent MLA Jignesh Mevani and 14 Congress MLAs for a day from the Assembly for unruly behaviour. The legislators demanded a discussion on the issues concerning agitating government employees and farmers. However, when the Speaker refused their demand, the legislators rushed near the well of the House and started shouting slogans.

136.title: ADB cuts India's growth forecast to 7% for FY23
136.article_body: Asian Development Bank (ADB) has slashed the GDP growth forecast for India to 7% for the current financial year. This is now slightly lower than the Reserve Bank of India's estimate of 7.2%. ADB said that inflated prices of commodities, oil and inflation will lead to continuing monetary policy tightening, which would hurt growth in the short run.

137.title: Juul Labs sues US FDA over documents related to e-cigarettes ban
137.article_body: Juul Labs has sued the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) after the latter refused to disclose documents supporting its order banning the sale of e-cigarettes in US on June 23. Juul said, "The public deserves a complete picture of the scientific facts behind one of the agency's most controversial and closely scrutinised decisions in recent years" of banning sales.

138.title: Zepto's 19-yr-old Co-founder youngest Indian with ₹1,000 cr personal wealth
138.article_body: Grocery delivery startup Zepto's 19-year-old Co-founder Kaivalya Vohra is the youngest Indian to have a personal wealth of at least ₹1,000 crore, according to Hurun India Rich List 2022. A majority of Vohra's wealth comes from an over 50% rise in the valuation of Zepto, which he founded with 20-year-old Aadit Palicha. Both Vohra and Palicha are Stanford University dropouts.

139.title: Loan apps on Google Play Store to display link to partner banks: Report
139.article_body: Google has reportedly asked loan disbursal apps on Play Store to mandatorily display a link to their partner banks or non-banking finance companies. Google updated its policies on loan apps on September 5, and the deadline for compliance was September 19. The tech giant said it will begin removing apps "that remain non-compliant with the requirements past the deadline provided".

140.title: Lightman, aide held for stealing equipment worth ₹21 lakh in Mumbai
140.article_body: The Mumbai Police have arrested a 22-year-old lighting technician, Shubham Prajapati, and his 24-year-old associate Nikhil Pawar, for stealing lighting equipment worth ₹21 lakh. According to the complaint, the accused were a part of a unit that was shooting a serial at the Mohammad Ali compound in Malvani, Malad and allegedly fled with a light and stand on May 26.

141.title: NIA court sends 4 suspected PFI members to 14-day custody in Hyd
141.article_body: The four people arrested on Monday by the National Investigation Agency (NIA) with alleged links to the Popular Front of India (PFI) were sent to 14-day judicial custody by a Nampally special court in Hyderabad. The NIA conducted multiple searches at 38 locations and seized cash, mobile phones and laptops. The accused were served notices under section 41 of CrPC.

142.title: 2 Naxals, including a woman, carrying reward of ₹6 lakh surrender in Maha
142.article_body:
Two Naxals, including a woman, carrying a collective reward of ₹6 lakh on their heads surrendered before the police in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli, a senior official said. The Naxals were identified as 26-year-old Anil alias Ramsay Kujur and 30-year-old Roshani Pallo, police said in a release.
Gadchiroli SP Ankit Goyal stated that 51 Naxals have surrendered since 2019.

143.title: Morgan Stanley to pay $35 million in fine to SEC over data security
143.article_body: Morgan Stanley has agreed to pay the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) $35 million for failing to protect consumer data while replacing the company's hard drives and servers. According to the SEC, the bank failed to properly dispose thousands of devices containing consumer data and some were even auctioned online. Morgan Stanley has neither accepted nor denied the allegations.

144.title: Ex-BSP MLA Mukhtar Ansari gets 2-year jail for threatening jailer
144.article_body: Former BSP MLA Mukhtar Ansari has reportedly been sentenced to two years in prison by the Allahabad High Court for threatening and pointing a gun at a jailor. The case dates back to 2003, when a Lucknow district prison jailer filed an FIR after he was threatened by Ansari for ordering a search of his visitors in jail.

145.title: IIT Madras incubated EV startup Esmito raises ₹10 cr in seed round
145.article_body: Electric vehicle startup Esmito Solutions, incubated by IIT Madras, has secured ₹10 crore in a seed funding round led by Unicorn India Ventures. The company was co-founded in 2018 by Prabhjot Kaur, Hasan Ali and Akhila Vijaykumar. In a press release, the startup said that the funds will be used to further strengthen the technology team.

146.title: Stray dogs maul doctor inside Hyd hospital; suffers deep injury, clothes torn
146.article_body: A doctor on duty at a Hyderabad hospital was mauled by a pack of stray dogs inside the hospital, following which she suffered a deep injury to her calf area and her clothes were torn. "There were no security guards available. Similar incidents have happened in the past too. So many complaints have gone in vain," a doctor said.

147.title: Hackers accessed some customer & employee data: American Airlines
147.article_body: American Airlines has said that an "unauthorised actor" accessed personal information of a small number of customers and employees through a phishing campaign. In a consumer notification letter, the carrier notified that the hacker may have obtained details like address and passport number. The airline engaged a cybersecurity forensic firm to investigate after the breach was discovered in July.

148.title: 2 arrested by ACB officials in Hyderabad for demanding ₹30,000 bribe
148.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) arrested two persons, a town planning supervisor and a private architect, for demanding a bribe of ₹30,000 in Hyderabad on Tuesday. The accused were identified as Akula Ashok and A Srinivas Rao. According to the complainant Devender Reddy, he had applied for permission to construct a house and the accused demanded a bribe of ₹30,000.

149.title: Sanskrit teachers in Uttar Pradesh to be trained for online teaching
149.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government will train Sanskrit teachers from government schools in the state for online teaching. The District Inspector of Schools (DIOS) of all 75 districts in the state have been asked to nominate 100 Sanskrit teachers for the training. The teachers will be given a five-day training by experts of Uttar Pradesh Sanskrit Sansthan, an official said.

150.title: Wipro fires 300 employees found 'Moonlighting' for competitors
150.article_body: Wipro terminated the services of 300 employees who were found to be working for its competitors at the same time, said Chairman Rishad Premji. Premji added, "If you actually look at the definition of 'Moonlighting', it is having a second job secretively…I'm all about transparency." He also termed 'Moonlighting' an "act of integrity violation".

151.title: US FTC asks for more details on Amazon, vacuum maker iRobot deal
151.article_body: The US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has asked Amazon and iRobot Corporation for more details on the former's $1.7-billion buyout of the Roomba vacuum maker. This development comes amid pro-privacy groups citing concerns about privacy and Amazon's already dominant smart home devices market position. In August, Amazon signed a deal to acquire iRobot for $61 apiece in an all-cash transaction.

152.title: Part of Sumanahalli Flyover in Bengaluru caves in
152.article_body: A part of the Sumanahalli Flyover in Bengaluru has caved in. This is the second time since 2019 that such an incident has occurred on the flyover which connects Tumakuru Road to Mysuru Road. Traffic police inspected the spot on Tuesday and barricaded it. The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is expected to take up repair work on Thursday.

153.title: PhyicsWallah's Co-founders, Zepto's 19-yr-old Co-founder debut on Hurun India Rich List
153.article_body: Edtech unicorn PhysicsWallah's Co-founders Alakh Pandey and Prateek Maheshwari have made their debut on the IIFL Wealth Hurun India Rich List 2022. Zepto Co-founder Kaivalya Vohra,19, is the youngest to debut on Hurun rich list. For the first time, 100 startup founders with a cumulative wealth of ₹5,06,000 crore and an average age of 40 have featured on the list.

154.title: 'If you don't know the whole story, shut up' posts Raj Kundra 1 year after being freed
154.article_body: Shilpa Shetty's husband Raj Kundra, who was released on bail one year ago in connection with the alleged creation and uploading of porn films on apps, posted a selfie wearing a hoodie and mask with the words "If you don't know the whole story...shut up!!!' written on the picture. He wrote, "Its a matter of time justice will be served!"

155.title: TN BJP leader arrested over threatening remarks against DMK's A Raja
155.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore district BJP president, Balaji Uthamaramasamy, has been arrested for allegedly making threatening remarks against senior DMK leader and Nilgiris MP A Raja. Uthamaramasamy, in a video, purportedly said that if Raja does not stop making derogatory remarks against Hindus, he would not be allowed to set foot at Coimbatore airport.

156.title: 5 arrested for online gambling in Goa
156.article_body: Five people have been arrested for allegedly being involved in online gambling activities in Goa, said police on Wednesday. The accused, all residents of Chhattisgarh, were conducting online gambling activities at Annette Beach Apartments using their laptops and mobile phones, added police. Items worth ₹1.2 lakh have been seized by the police.

157.title: Won't lift wet garbage from big housing societies from October 2: PCMC
157.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has identified 700 big housing societies that generate more than 100 kg of waste per day and said it would not lift wet waste from these societies from October 2. The corporation said it had asked the societies to segregate wet and dry waste and convert wet waste into compost within their premises several times.

158.title: 2 residents of Mumbai housing society win parking space after 20 yrs
158.article_body: Two residents have won parking space after a battle of over 20 years with their housing society in Mumbai's Kandivali. The plaintiffs claimed they had been kept on the waiting list to receive parking space after paying ₹30,000. However, the society didn't give them preference over newcomers. A court has directed it to pay ₹20,000 for mental agony and harassment.

159.title: Girl dies after school bus hits, brushes past her abdomen in Mumbai
159.article_body: A nine-year-old girl died after being hit by a speeding school bus in Mumbai. According to the FIR, the front wheel of the bus brushed past her abdomen. Police said the girl refused treatment after the accident, insisting that she just wanted to go back home to her mother. However, two days later, she complained of abdominal pain and collapsed.

160.title: Hijab restricted only in classrooms; not on campus, school transport: K'taka AG to SC
160.article_body: Hijab is only restricted in classrooms, Karnataka Advocate General (AG) Prabhuling Navadgi told the Supreme Court. "We haven't prohibited it outside...no restriction on school transport or on campus," he added. "Today hijab, tomorrow someone can come wearing 'gamcha'. We can't sustain this in secular institutions like schools," Additional Solicitor General KM Nataraj, representing Karnataka, said.

161.title: 101 cattle dead due to lumpy skin disease in Madhya Pradesh so far
161.article_body: About 101 cattle died due to lumpy skin disease in Madhya Pradesh so far, according to data released by Chief Minister's office. A total of 7,686 animals were affected across 26 districts, out of which 5,432 animals were cured, data showed. "Just like we fought...COVID-19, we'll fight this lumpy virus to save...lives of animals," CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said.

162.title: Staging of comedy got new identity because of Raju Srivastava: President
162.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Wednesday mourned the loss of comedian Raju Srivastava, saying that his untimely demise is extremely sad. "He had an uncanny talent to enthral the audience with his comical performances," President Murmu tweeted. "Due to his influence, the staging of comedy in India got a new identity. My condolences to his family and fans," she added.

163.title: Imperialism plain and simple: German Chancellor at UNGA on Russia's war
163.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz criticised Russian invasion of Ukraine at the United Nations General Assembly, calling it "imperialism". "We must not stand...by when a major nuclear power, armed to the teeth...seeks to shift borders through the use of violence," he added. Scholz said Russian President Vladimir Putin risks destroying not only Ukraine but also his own country with the war.

164.title: What magic did you do on Mamata?: Gehlot to Vice President Dhankhar
164.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot asked Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar what ''magic'' did he do on ''tough lady'' like Mamata Banerjee that she abstained from voting during the Vice President election held in August. Dhankhar, who was addressing Rajasthan Assembly, replied that he asked Mamata to keep her hand on heart and think if he had done anything against the Constitution.

165.title: 'Havan' performed outside Jodhpur DC office over cattle deaths
165.article_body: Several protesters gathered outside the office of the District Collectorate in Rajasthan's Jodhpur to perform a 'havan' over the death of thousands of cattle due to lumpy skin disease. The protesters demanded a compensation of ₹50,000 for their dead cattle from the government. They also sought adequate treatment for the cows affected by the disease.

166.title: Willing to make efforts for peaceful reunification with Taiwan: China
166.article_body: China is willing to make the greatest efforts to achieve peaceful reunification with Taiwan, Ma Xiaoguang, spokesperson for China's Taiwan Affairs Office said. China considers democratically-governed Taiwan as its own territory and threatens to use force to bring the island nation under its control. In August, China launched military drills near Taiwan after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit.

167.title: Pic of Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal's wedding invite goes viral
167.article_body: Actors Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal are set to tie the knot in October. The couple released their wedding invite which has a pop art design featuring sketches of Richa and Ali. The invite looks like a matchbox and the text printed on it reads 'Couple Matches'. They will reportedly have wedding celebrations and functions in Delhi and Mumbai.

168.title: Qualcomm-backed drone maker IdeaForge considers $125 mn IPO: Report
168.article_body: Qualcomm-backed drone maker IdeaForge Technology is reportedly considering raising about $125 million through an initial public offering. It is looking at a valuation of about $700 million in the share sale, which could mostly comprise new shares. The firm was founded in 2007 by IIT-Bombay alumni and is a licensed manufacturer of unmanned aerial vehicles approved by the Defence Ministry.

169.title: Man carrying fake currency worth ₹3.16 lakh arrested in Hyderabad
169.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested one person, Kasthuri Ramesh Babu, for allegedly carrying fake currency notes worth ₹3.16 lakh, police said. Police seized 2,500 fake notes of ₹100 denomination, 45 half-printed fake notes of ₹100 denomination and 92 half-printed fake notes of ₹500 denomination. Police also seized a laptop, two printers, one paper cutting machine, one mobile phone and a four-wheeler.

170.title: Auto-rickshaw driver rapes woman selling cigarettes in Thane; arrested
170.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver has been arrested for allegedly raping a woman vendor near Bhayandar railway station in Thane. The incident took place on September 17, when the woman was selling cigarettes near a rickshaw stand. The 28-year-old accused offered to buy all her stock, took her to an isolated place and raped her inside the auto-rickshaw, police said.

171.title: Tata to bring AirAsia India, Vistara under Air India brand by 2024: Report
171.article_body: Tata Group is planning to merge AirAsia India with Air India Express and Vistara with Air India by 2024, The Indian Express reported. Tata Group, which owns an 83.67% stake in AirAsia India and a 51% stake in Vistara, is planning to purchase AirAsia India's remaining stake for $30 million. AirAsia India's merger will likely take 12 months to complete.

172.title: Pakistani actress Sehar Shinwari mocks Pandya over 'We'll learn' post, gets trolled
172.article_body: Pakistani actress Sehar Shinwari mocked Hardik Pandya over his 'We'll learn' post on Twitter after Australia's victory against India in the first T20I. "Please lose next match to Pakistan on 23rd October...you'll learn more from it," Sehar wrote. Trolling her, an Indian fan wrote, "Have some shame...you lost to England at home." "Are you familiar with...term 'Udta teer'?" wrote another.

173.title: Raju Srivastava provided the divine gift of laughter to many: Kumar Vishvas
173.article_body: Poet Dr Kumar Vishvas expressed his grief on the demise of comedian Raju Srivastava. Vishvas called Srivastava as someone who "provided the divine gift of laughter" to many people.
