Actor Rajpal Yadav and comedienne Bharti Singh also mourned Srivastava's demise. Yadav tweeted, "You'll be missed my brother", while Singh said the news is "unbelievable and heartbreaking".

174.title: Amanatullah Khan discharged from AIIMS, to appear before court today
174.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Amanatullah Khan has been discharged from Delhi's AIIMS, where he was admitted on Tuesday after complaining about chest pain. Khan is currently in the custody of Delhi Police's Anti-Corruption Bureau. He will be produced before the Rouse Avenue Court at 4 pm today (Wednesday) in connection with illegal recruitments in the Delhi Waqf Board.

175.title: Grandfather, uncle sexually assault 20-yr-old woman, booked by Mumbai Police
175.article_body: The Mumbai Police have booked the grandfather and an uncle of a 20-year-old woman for allegedly sexually assaulting her. The police arrested her 52-year-old grandfather on Sunday and sent a team to UP to trace the uncle, after learning that he had been raping the woman for 12 years. Her uncle told her to not inform anyone, an officer said.

176.title: Swaraj Engines hits 52-week high after becoming M&M subsidiary
176.article_body: Shares of diesel engine manufacturer Swaraj Engines Limited surged the most since June 2020 gaining 13% to ₹1,919 after it became Mahindra & Mahindra's subsidiary company. Its stock hit a 52-week high in intraday trading. Mahindra & Mahindra announced that it would acquire 17.4% equity of the Kirloskar Industries-owned Swaraj Engines for a total cash consideration of ₹296 crore.

177.title: Comedian Raju Srivastava's funeral to be held on Thursday in Delhi
177.article_body: Late comedian Raju Srivastava's funeral will be held at Nigambodh Ghat in Delhi on Thursday, his family confirmed. Srivastava passed away at the age of 58. He was admitted to AIIMS in Delhi on August 10 after he suffered a heart attack and collapsed while working out in the gym. He had undergone angioplasty and was put on a ventilator.

178.title: Gautam Adani made over ₹1,600 crore per day over the last year: Hurun
178.article_body: Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani made over ₹1,600 crore per day on average, over the last year, according to Hurun India Rich List 2022 released on Wednesday. The 60-year-old business tycoon has topped the list with a wealth of ₹10,94,400 crore. Adani is ahead of Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani by ₹3 lakh crore in terms of estimated wealth.

179.title: BJP calls T'gana CM 'Kasim Chandrashekar Rizvi' over closeness with AIMIM
179.article_body: Telangana BJP President Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Tuesday compared Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao with Razakars militia founder Kasim Rizvi and called him 'Kasim Chandrashekar Rizvi' over his closeness with AIMIM. "We'll fight CM KCR...We're sons and force of saffron...But if you target my Hindu Dharma Rakshaks and Gau Rakshaks, we won't leave you," Kumar said.

180.title: Putin's threats to West must be taken very seriously: UK
180.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's threat to the West that he has lots of weapons is "chilling" and must be taken "very seriously", UK Foreign Office minister Gillian Keegan said. Putin on Wednesday ordered Russia's first military mobilisation since World War II, warning that Moscow would respond with the might of all its vast arsenal if West continues its "nuclear blackmail".

181.title: Not confirming it yet: Ayan on Deepika being part of Brahmastra's sequel
181.article_body: 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji said people have "imagined" Deepika Padukone as Amrita. His reaction came after fans claimed that a viral photo featured Deepika holding baby Shiva in her arms. "What you want to see is what you see. We're not confirming that Deepika is a part of part one or part two yet," Ayan said.

182.title: Raju Srivastava made the country laugh, sad that he's gone: Sunil Grover
182.article_body: Comedian-actor Sunil Grover mourned comedian Raju Srivastava's death. "He made the whole country laugh. It's sad today that he has gone, too soon," Grover wrote on Instagram. Ajay Devgn thanked Srivastava for gifting the audience with laughter and wrote, "Your untimely demise makes me very sad." Vicky Kaushal, Varun Dhawan, Malaika Arora and many others also paid their condolences.

183.title: BJP stages protest demanding CBI probe into 5-yr-old boy's death in WB
183.article_body: The BJP on Wednesday staged a protest outside the West Bengal Assembly against the TMC-led government over the death of a five-year-old boy in Birbhum. "We demand...CBI inquiry. A BJP delegation will meet...family of the deceased," Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari said. The boy reportedly went missing on Sunday and was found dead in his neighbour's house on Tuesday evening.

184.title: Mrunal Thakur stood out the most, truly a queen: Kangana on 'Sita Ramam'
184.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut called 'Sita Ramam' a "spectacular experience" and said Mrunal Thakur "stood out the most" for her. "Restrained emotions and rare dignity in her demeanour, no other actress could have portrayed...truly a queen," Kangana wrote, adding, "Thakur saab, here begins your reign." 'Sita Ramam', also starring Dulquer Salmaan, is directed by Hanu Raghavapudi.

185.title: Activist, who raised voice against PDS corruption, dies by suicide in K'taka
185.article_body: Activist Veerachari, who had filed complaints against corruption by Public Distribution System (PDS) contractor Siddaramappa, allegedly died by suicide in Karnataka's Davanagere on Tuesday. He had met the Deputy Commissioner (DC) on Monday to complain about Siddaramappa facing no action. "He ended his life over this fight and...we want action against the shop owner," Veerachari's daughter said.

186.title: Not our delivery partner: Zomato after delivery agent molests Pune woman
186.article_body: Online food delivery platform Zomato has issued a statement after a food delivery agent molested a 19-year-old woman in Pune. In its statement, Zomato said the accused is not its delivery partner, adding that it conducts third-party background verifications while onboarding any person to its fleet. The 40-year-old man allegedly kissed the woman twice after finding her alone at home.

187.title: Being Shah Rukh Khan's wife works against me 50% of the time: Gauri
187.article_body: Gauri Khan, during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', said some people consider her a designer when considering a new project. However, she added it doesn't work this way sometimes. "Sometimes people do not want to get attached to the baggage of working with Shah Rukh Khan's wife. It works against me 50% of the time," she added.

188.title: Filing cases, arresting Oppn leaders seem to be Centre's flagship project: Pawar
188.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday said filing cases and arresting Opposition leaders seem to be the "flagship project" of the Centre. "If you check today's newspaper, it has detailed how central probe agencies have increased their actions against the Opposition parties and leaders," Pawar added. "The key issues and challenges before the society are kept aside," he stated.

189.title: Mumbai man captures Indian monitor lizard for meat & oil, arrested
189.article_body: A man was arrested near Mumbai's Aksa Beach for capturing an Indian monitor lizard for its meat and oil. The reptile was found dead by the police. The investigating officer said the crime was driven by the belief that the reptile's oil brings relief to people suffering from knee and joint problems. The accused is a resident of Malad.

190.title: 230 pilot whales stranded on Tasmania's west coast, half presumed dead
190.article_body: About 230 whales have been stranded on Ocean Beach on Tasmania's west coast. According to the Department of Natural Resources and Environment Tasmania, the pod appears to be pilot whales and at least half are presumed to be alive. On Monday, 14 dead sperm whales were discovered on King Island in the Bass Strait between Melbourne and Tasmania's northern coast.

191.title: Cong MLA Deepika Pandey takes bath on waterlogged road in J'khand to demand its repair
191.article_body: Congress MLA Deepika Pandey Singh sat on a dharna on waterlogged NH-133 which passes through Jharkhand to protest the poor road quality and demand its repair. While protesting, she took bath on the road in a symbolic gesture. The road has been in a bad condition for a long time and accidents happen on the road every day, she said.

192.title: Delhi govt to issue pension cards for senior citizens, differently-abled
192.article_body: The Delhi government will issue pension cards for senior citizens and differently-abled persons to make the process of pension disbursement easier, Social Welfare Minister Rajendra Pal Gautam said. "It's our duty to ensure...they're given a pension in...timely manner," he said. Delhi government provides a monthly pension of ₹2,500 to 4.5 lakh elderly people and 1.14 lakh differently able persons.

193.title: Man kills female friend with axe over suspicion of affair in Ghaziabad
193.article_body: A 25-year-old allegedly murdered his 33-year-old female friend over suspicion of an affair in Ghaziabad. The incident occurred on September 16 at her flat in the Deen Dayal Puri area. According to police, the accused assaulted the woman several times, including on the head, with an axe, and later fled away from the scene. Police on Tuesday arrested the accused.

194.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face scheduled power cuts tomorrow
194.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) has announced some scheduled power shutdowns in parts of the city tomorrow (September 22) as Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation (KPTCL) will carry out maintenance works in the city. Power outages will occur between 10 am and 4 pm. The BESCOM divisions which will be affected tomorrow are - Kanakapura, Kengeri, Davanagere and Hiriyuru.

195.title: Flowers left in tribute to Queen Elizabeth to be composted, reused in parks
195.article_body: Flowers left in tribute in London's parks for Queen Elizabeth II will be composted and reused on planting projects, the city's Royal Parks said. The compost will be used on landscaping projects and shrubberies across the parks, it added. Work to remove the bunches of flowers will begin next Monday, a week after the state funeral for the late sovereign.

196.title: Will miss you 'Gajodhar Bhaiya': Mann on Laughter Challenge co-contestant Raju's death
196.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann mourned the demise of his 'The Great Indian Laughter Challenge' co-contestant Raju Srivastava. "He made us laugh a lot...but today it's very sad to hear this news...Worked a lot with him and got to learn a lot," tweeted Mann. "We'll miss you 'Gajodhar Bhaiya'," he added while referring to the character developed by Srivastava.

197.title: Leopard carcass found in field in UP's Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary
197.article_body: A female leopard's carcass was recovered from an agricultural field in Uttar Pradesh's Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary on Tuesday morning. According to the post-mortem report, it's suspected that the incident occurred following a conflict between two leopards. While the deceased leopard is estimated to be around one-and-a-half years, the second leopard is likely to be older, the report stated.

198.title: Raju Srivastava suffered another cardiac arrest in morning: Late comedian's nephew
198.article_body: According to comedian Raju Srivastava's nephew Kushal, he suffered another cardiac arrest on Wednesday morning, which he could not survive. Srivastava passed away at the age of 58. He was admitted to AIIMS in Delhi after suffering a heart attack and collapsing while working out in a gym on August 10.

199.title: Assam govt may regulate private madrassas: Education minister
199.article_body: Assam government may regulate all the private madrassas under an existing Act, the state Education Minister Ranoj Pegu said. "The government is considering if private seminaries can be brought under the control of the Assam Non-Government Educational Institutions (Regulation and Management) Act, 2006," he added. "All non-governmental schools are not covered under this Act," Pegu stated.

200.title: Man beaten up with sticks by daughter-in-law's family in Gurugram, dies
200.article_body: A 55-year-old man died after being beaten up with sticks by his daughter-in-law's family members in Gurugram, police said on Tuesday. The deceased man's wife alleged that the accused also beat her up when she tried to save her husband. Reportedly, their daughter-in-law had a tussle with their son and, therefore, she went to her maternal home four days ago.

201.title: Who are the 10 richest Indians and what are their wealths according to Hurun?
201.article_body: Gautam Adani & family have topped the Hurun India Rich List 2022 with a wealth of ₹10,94,400 crore. They're followed by Mukesh Ambani & family with a wealth of ₹7,94,700 crore. Cyrus S Poonawalla & family rank third, followed by the families of HCL Tech's Shiv Nadar, DMart's Radhakishan Damani, Gautam Adani's brother Vinod Shantilal Adani, and SP Hinduja.

202.title: He was supposed to be removed from ventilator in 2-3 days: Raju Srivastava's family
202.article_body: Late Raju Srivastava's brother-in-law told IndiaToday.in that the comedian was supposed to be removed from the ventilator in two or three days, adding that his medicine doses had been decreased. He said, "In the morning, his BP dropped and then he was given CPR. At first, he responded to it but later collapsed." Srivastava's funeral will be held in Delhi.

203.title: Won't say no if people in Cong think I'm needed in role of party chief: Gehlot
203.article_body: Rajasthan CM and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said, "If people in the party think I'm needed in the role of party President or CM, then I won't say no." Furthermore, he said, "I'll again request Rahul Gandhi. If he conducts 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' as party President, then it'll create an aura for the party."

204.title: Be proactive, need to bring transparency in system: Nadda to Guj party workers
204.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Tuesday asked party workers and elected representatives in Gujarat to "be proactive, pro responsible and pro responsive". "We'll have to bring transparency in system and deliver in transparent manner…this will keep people's faith alive in us," Nadda said while addressing elected representatives from gram to district panchayats, municipal corporations and others.

205.title: Manipur Cabinet approves lifting prohibition partially
205.article_body: To boost the state's revenue, the Manipur Cabinet has decided to partially lift the ban on brewing, consumption and sale of liquor. Prohibition will be lifted from all district headquarters, including Imphal city, tourist destinations and hotels with at least 20 beds, said the state's Tribal Affairs Minister Letpao Haokip. The government is also mulling to export traditionally brewed liquor.

206.title: Public representatives have become a 'laughing stock': VP Dhankhar
206.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday expressed concern over "inappropriate conduct" of public representatives inside Parliament and state Assemblies, adding that they have become a "laughing stock" in front of the public. "Those who should discuss Parliament and Assembly have come on roads," Dhankhar said. "Time has come for a widespread contemplation on this serious situation," he added.

207.title: Massive traffic jam on NH-48 from Kherki toll to G'gram's Hero Honda Chowk
207.article_body: A huge traffic jam was reported on NH-48 from Kherki toll to Hero Honda Chowk towards Delhi on Wednesday morning due to the closure of Jaipur-Delhi carriageway of Hero Honda Chowk flyover on the Delhi-Gurugram Expressway. A five-kilometre-long queue of vehicles was reportedly seen from the junction to the Cloverleaf flyover. The carriageway will remain shut till September 26.

208.title: 40-yr-old teacher, 17-yr-old girl student found hanging in forest in UP
208.article_body: A 40-year-old school teacher and his 17-year-old girl student were found hanging in the forest in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur on Tuesday, police said. The teacher was having an affair with the girl who studied in the same school where he worked, police added. The state of the bodies suggests that both had committed suicide about ten days ago, police stated.

209.title: Activist breaks down at UNGA after appealing for education for Afghan girls
209.article_body: Afghan activist Somaya Faruqi broke down backstage after urging leaders at the United Nations to protect girls' education and women's rights in Afghanistan. On Sunday, the UN urged the Taliban to reopen high schools for Afghan girls that have been shut for a year. The Taliban have barred women from leaving homes without a male relative and a face cover.

210.title: Majority of states want Rahul to be Congress President: Sachin Pilot
210.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said that majority of states want Rahul Gandhi to be Congress President. "Whether he will contest or not, that's his decision, but one thing is for sure, party will get a new President on October 17th," he added. His statement comes after reports claimed that Shashi Tharoor and Ashok Gehlot might contest for Congress chief post.

211.title: Ratan Tata nominated as trustee of PM CARES Fund
211.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata, former Supreme Court judge KT Thomas and former Deputy Lok Sabha Speaker Kariya Munda have been nominated as trustees of the PM CARES Fund, the government said. The announcement came a day after Prime Minister Narendra Modi chaired the board of trustees meeting that was attended by Union Ministers Amit Shah and Nirmala Sitharaman.

212.title: Road ministry issues draft rules for mandatory rear seat belt alarms
212.article_body: Union Ministry of Road, Transport and Highways has issued draft rules to make it mandatory for car makers to install an alarm system for rear seat belts. Recently, former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry died in a car accident and it was reported that while he was sitting in the rear seat, he didn’t have his seat belt on.

213.title: AIIMS doctor transferred for taking money to perform surgery
213.article_body: A doctor from AIIMS, Delhi has been transferred to the National Cancer Institute in Jhajjar after he was found to have taken money from a patient's father for performing a surgery. According to a fact-finding committee's report, Dr KK Roy allegedly asked for ₹34,000 citing the need to procure supplies. Roy said the accusation is not correct.

214.title: He was and will remain king of comedy: Sunil Pal on Raju Srivastava
214.article_body: Comedian Sunil Pal called Raju Srivastava a "brave warrior" who fought till his last breath. "He was, is and will always remain the king of stand-up comedy," Sunil said, adding that his death has left a big void in the entertainment industry. "Raju Srivastava cannot be replaced. His memories will live in our hearts forever," he added.

215.title: US, Canadian warships sail through Taiwan Strait, China condemns action
215.article_body: A US Navy warship and a Canadian frigate made a routine transit through the Taiwan Strait on Tuesday, both countries' militaries confirmed. China condemned the mission, saying its forces "warned" the ships. The transit was reportedly the second in a month by a US Navy ship and the second jointly by the US and Canada since October 2021.

216.title: Engineer arrested for attacking cab driver with knife, assaulting policemen
216.article_body: The Pune Police arrested a 27-year-old software engineer for allegedly attacking a cab driver with a knife after he rejected the trip and also for assaulting two policemen who responded to the situation. The accused attacked one of the policemen with wooden rod and pushed the other. The cab driver sustained injury on stomach but is out of danger.

217.title: Over 300 booked for clash during Ganesh Chaturthi procession in K'taka
217.article_body: More than 300 people have been booked for allegedly attacking the Ganesh Chaturthi procession in Ranebennur of Karnataka's Haveri district, police said. The accused attacked the procession with lethal weapons, triggering violence in the area, police added. "No matter what community they belong to, strict action should be taken against them," JD(S) spokesperson Tanveer Ahmed said.

218.title: Goldman Sachs fires at least 25 bankers in Asia: Report
218.article_body: Goldman Sachs has laid off at least 25 bankers in Asia, Bloomberg News reported. The job cuts impacted junior-level bankers involved in deals in Greater China, the report added. In 2021, Goldman Sachs increased hiring in mainland China and Hong Kong after their financial markets opened to foreign brokerages. The bank's headcount increased to 47,000 by June end.

219.title: BYJU'S shifting focus to profitable growth: CEO tells employees
219.article_body: BYJU'S Founder and CEO, Byju Raveendran, told employees that the company has already started shifting focus towards profitable growth and the idea is to allocate resources effectively to maximise impact. Last week, BYJU'S released audited financial statement for FY21 after a delay of nearly 18 months. The ed-tech firm recorded a ₹4,588 crore loss in FY21, financial results showed.

220.title: Air Force allows PMC to build road on defence land to reach Pune airport
220.article_body: The Air Force has given approval to Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) for building an alternate road to Vimannagar through their land. According to officials, PMC requires 2,350 square meters of defence land to complete the road connecting Pune airport with Vimannagar. "PMC had...constructed the road from both ends...only the Air Force road portion was pending," Pune MP Girish Bapat said.

221.title: Triveni Turbine's stock jumps 6.6% after reports of block deal
221.article_body: Triveni Turbine Limited's shares traded 6.6% higher at ₹243.5 apiece on Wednesday after reports of multiple block deals involving 70.5 million shares changing hands. Triveni Engineering and Industries Ltd, which holds a 21.85% stake in Triveni Turbine, reportedly launched a block deal to sell a stake of 11.85%. The details of the buyers and sellers are yet to be known.

222.title: Actress Bharti Jaffery, daughter of legendary Ashok Kumar, dies
222.article_body: Actress Bharti Jaffrey, daughter of legendary actor Ashok Kumar, passed away on Tuesday after a prolonged illness. Actor Kanwaljit Singh, who is married to Bharti's daughter Anuradha Patel, shared the news of her demise on social media. Bharti Jaffrey starred in movies such as Hazaar Chaurasi Ki Maa, Saans and Daman. She was married to Saeed Jaffrey's brother, Hamid Jaffrey.

223.title: Air India Express incurs net loss for first time in 7 years due to COVID-19
223.article_body: Air India Express, which mainly operates flights between India and the Gulf countries, reported a net loss for the first time in seven years because of the COVID-19 pandemic. The airline posted a net loss of ₹72.33 crore in FY22, against a net profit of ₹98.21 crore in FY21. In FY15, it had posted a net loss of ₹61 crore.

224.title: Raju Srivastava took genre of comedy to new heights with his talent: UP CM
224.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath expressed his grief over the demise of comedian Raju Srivastava. "Raju Srivastava is no more with us. I, on behalf of the people of UP, pray that his soul rests in peace," CM Yogi said. "Raju Srivastava took the genre of comedy…to new heights with his talent and hard work," he stated.

225.title: Residents oppose building of animal hospital in Pune's Hadapsar
225.article_body: Residents of Pune's Hadapsar opposed PMC's decision to build a hospital for animals in the area. "We too want other infrastructure projects in Hadapsar but we only find garbage processing plants and now this animal hospital," said a former NCP corporator. The hospital should be built in a locality where citizens have greater love for stray dogs, said a resident.

226.title: Vehicular movement to be affected in Kurla, police shares diversion routes
226.article_body: The vehicular movement will be hit in Mumbai's Kurla area due to work related to a sewage line and Metro 2 B construction, the Mumbai Traffic Police said. The traffic restrictions will be in place from 12 am on October 1 till 12 am on March 1, 2023. The traffic police shared the list of optional routes for vehicular movement.

227.title: Will use all means to protect Russia if threatened, this is not a bluff: Putin to West
227.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered the country's first mobilisation since WWII, warning that Russia would respond with the might of all its vast arsenal if West continues its "nuclear blackmail". Accusing West of plotting to destroy Russia amid the war in Ukraine, Putin said, "If...threatened, we'll use all available means to protect our people - this isn't a bluff."

228.title: There's no particular reason for its failure: Ronit Roy on 'Liger'
228.article_body: Actor Ronit Roy said he personally doesn't think there's any particular reason behind the box office failure of his recent release, 'Liger'. "You cannot pinpoint something like that. You may hear people say one reason which the majority will agree with, but not every single person thinks like that," he said. Ronit played MMA coach in the Puri Jagannadh directorial.

229.title: Central agencies get their script from BJP office: RJD's Manoj Jha
229.article_body: RJD leader Manoj Kumar Jha on Tuesday extended support to the resolution passed in the West Bengal Assembly against the alleged excessive interference of central agencies. These agencies get their script from the BJP office, Jha stated. He said that according to a report in an English daily, 95% of the cases probed by these agencies are of Opposition leaders.

230.title: Man arrested for vandalising police van, manhandling constable in Pune
230.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested for allegedly vandalising a police van and manhandling an on-duty police constable in Pune's Bhosari, police said. "The accused initially hurled a stone at the van...constable was inside...he got down...(accused) manhandled the constable and verbally abused him," police added. "We are probing why he suddenly resorted to vandalising the police vehicle," police stated.

231.title: Mumbai sees 120 new COVID-19 cases, nearly double from day before
231.article_body: Mumbai reported 120 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, nearly double the number seen a day before, when it recorded 66 infections, according to BMC. With one new fatality, the overall death toll reached 19,726, while the cumulative case count climbed to 11,49,235 in the city. The number of active cases stood at 936.

232.title: Raju Srivastava brightened our lives with laughter, his demise is saddening: PM Modi
232.article_body: After the death of comedian Raju Srivastava, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Raju Srivastava brightened our lives with laughter, humour and positivity." "He leaves us too soon but he will continue to live in hearts of countless people thanks to his rich work over the years. His demise is saddening. Condolences to his family and admirers. Om Shanti," he wrote.

233.title: Central Bank of India stock jumps 15.5% after RBI lifts PCA curb
233.article_body: The shares of Central Bank of India opened 15.5% higher on Wednesday after the Reserve Bank of India removed it from the prompt corrective action (PCA) framework after a period of over five years. The lender was put under the PCA framework in June 2017 because of its high net non-performing assets and low return on assets.

234.title: Constable found dead in Pune CRPF campus, police suspect suicide
234.article_body: A 30-year-old constable of the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) was found dead on the CRPF campus in Pune district's Talegaon Dabhade on Tuesday morning. According to officials, the deceased, identified as Amaresh Kumar Giri, hailed from Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur district. "Primary investigation points to death by suicide. We have launched an investigation," said Inspector Ganesh Jawadwad.

235.title: HK arrests harmonica player at Queen Elizabeth's vigil for sedition
235.article_body: A 43-year-old harmonica player who went to the British consulate in Hong Kong on Monday night to pay tribute to UK Queen Elizabeth II, among scores of mourners, was arrested for alleged sedition. The man reportedly played several songs on his harmonica, including the 'Glory to Hong Kong', the unofficial anthem of pro-democracy protests that rocked the city in 2019.

236.title: Boeing to cut 150 finance jobs in US, may outsource some jobs to India
236.article_body: Planemaker Boeing has said that it will cut 150 finance jobs in the US, with more to come next year and thereafter, in a bid to simplify its corporate structure. The first layoff notices will go out in October. As per a report, the company may outsource some finance and accounting jobs to TCS in India.

237.title: He created his presence in world: Akhilesh on Raju Srivastava's demise
237.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav condoled comedian Raju Srivastava's demise, saying that he created his presence in the world with his talent and hard work. "He came from a poor family…I remember how he wanted to contest from Kanpur when he joined SP," Yadav added. Furthermore, Yadav said that there are very few talented comedians like him.

238.title: Clash between woman, beautician at Delhi salon over eyebrow treatment
238.article_body: Two women were booked by police after a clash erupted between them at a South Delhi salon over "botched-up" eyebrow treatment. The customer, 48, did not like the eyebrow work and an argument broke out between them which escalated into a fight. The customer alleged that she was bitten on her arm while the beautician said her clothes were torn.

239.title: Japanese man sets himself on fire in alleged protest over ex-PM's state funeral
239.article_body: A man, in his 70s, set himself on fire near Japanese Prime Minister's office in an alleged protest against state funeral for former PM Shinzo Abe, reports said. The man reportedly told police he had deliberately doused himself in oil. A letter with words "I strongly oppose it" was found nearby. A police officer trying to extinguish flames was injured.

240.title: Ashutosh Gowariker predicted Chhello Show's Oscars entry: Director Pan Nalin
240.article_body: 'Chhello Show' director Pan Nalin said Ashutosh Gowariker had predicted the film's selection for Oscars five months ago. Remembering Gowariker's reaction after watching the film, Nalin shared, "He said, 'Pack your bags, you guys are going to the Oscars'. This happened five months ago. We laughed then and forgot about it. Aaj yaad aa raha hai (Today I remember it)."

241.title: Samajwadi Party and truth are 2 banks of river, can never meet: CM Yogi
241.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said Samajwadi Party and truth are two banks of a river which can never meet. "It's time [Akhilesh] Yadav learns to speak the truth in the house," CM Yogi added. His remark came as Yadav on Tuesday questioned the health system of UP inside the House on the second day of the Monsoon session.

242.title: Intimacy scenes are not exotic, they're most awkward to shoot: Pooja Bhatt
242.article_body: Pooja Bhatt said Vidya Balan called her after the release of 'Bombay Begums' and expressed how she didn't "cringe" when she saw her kissing on screen. Recalling the compliment, Pooja said that people feel that shooting intimate scenes is "exotic", but she called them the "most awkward thing to shoot". She added, "The challenge is to make it look bearable."

243.title: I want to spend the day with you naked: Singer Adam Levine in message to yoga teacher
243.article_body: After 'Maroon 5' singer Adam Levine was accused of cheating on his wife Behati Prinsloo by a model, a yoga teacher has shared a message that he sent her. "I want to spend the day with you naked," he wrote in the message, according to Alanna Zabel. She said that she taught Levine yoga from 2007 to 2010.

244.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal condoles demise of comedian Raju Srivastava
244.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal expressed his grief at the demise of comedian Raju Srivastava on Wednesday. "Very sad to hear [about] the demise of famous comedian Raju Srivastava ji. My condolences to his family and all...fans in this time of sorrow," Kejriwal tweeted. Srivastava was admitted to AIIMS Delhi on August 10 after suffering a heart attack and collapsing.

245.title: Samantha's manager dismisses reports that she went to US over 'rare skin condition'
245.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu's manager Mahendra has rubbished the rumours that she travelled to the US to undergo treatment for some 'rare skin condition'. Reports claimed her alleged medical condition was the reason for her refraining from public appearances, however, Samantha's manager said, "It's gossip." He did not explain the nature of Samantha's foreign trip.

246.title: RSS head meets Muslim intellectuals to discuss religious inclusivity
246.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat met with several Muslim intellectuals to discuss ways to strengthen religious inclusivity in the country, reported ANI. Former MP Shahid Siddiqui, who attended the meeting, said, "We are concerned that whatever is happening in the country is weakening the religious unity in the country." "Bhagwat belongs to an institution which is followed by many," he added.

247.title: 4 Ukrainian regions to vote in a referendum this week to join Russia
247.article_body: Russia-controlled regions of Ukraine, which include Luhansk, Kherson, Zaporizhzhia and Donetsk, plan to vote this week to become parts of Russia. Dmitry Medvedev, Deputy Chairman of Russia's Security Council, said referendums that fold regions into Russia would make redrawn frontiers "irreversible". Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba denounced vote, saying referendums will change nothing.

248.title: Deeply saddened by passing away of Raju Srivastava: Rajnath Singh
248.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh mourned the loss of comedian Raju Srivastava. The minister tweeted that he is "deeply saddened" to learn about Srivastava's death and extended his condolences to his family and fans. "Apart from being an accomplished artist, he was also a very lively person," the tweet read. The comedian died at the age of 58 in Delhi today.

249.title: Rahul resumes Bharat Jodo Yatra, pays tributes to Sree Narayana Guru
249.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday resumed Bharat Jodo Yatra from Kerala's Madavana. He was accompanied by several party leaders, including Sachin Pilot. On the 14th day of the 'yatra', the Wayanad MP paid floral tributes to social reformer Sree Narayana Guru. The Congress party shared several images of Gandhi mixing with people during the foot march.

250.title: Even poorest of Indian citizen deserves best quality products: Piyush Goyal
250.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said even the poorest citizen of the country deserves the best quality products and the culture of no compromise with quality has to be adopted in the country. "We need to change this mindset of two quality standards for domestic and international markets and must not compromise with quality," Goyal added.

251.title: Great loss to the world of art: Amit Shah on death of Raju Srivastava
251.article_body: After the demise of comedian Raju Srivastava, Home Minister Amit Shah tweeted, "He had a unique style, he impressed everyone with his amazing talent." "His death is a great loss to the world of art. I express my condolences to his family and fans. May God give them the strength to bear this grief," he wrote.

252.title: Fire breaks out at Andhra's paper plate factory; 3, including owner, killed
252.article_body: At least three persons died as a fire broke out at a paper plate manufacturing factory in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor on Tuesday. The owner of the factory was among the deceased. The other two victims were at the owner's house in the same building to celebrate his son's birthday.  "Investigating is underway...Some of the workers taken to hospital," police said.

253.title: All SC constitution bench hearings to be live-streamed from Sept 27
253.article_body: In a full court meeting on Tuesday, the judges of the Supreme Court unanimously decided to start live-streaming of all constitution bench hearings from September 27. This comes a week after senior advocate Indira Jaising wrote to CJI UU Lalit and other judges requesting live streaming of proceedings of public and constitutional importance.

254.title: Delhi lane of Gurugram's Hero Honda flyover to be closed from Sept 21-26
254.article_body: The Jaipur-Delhi carriageway of the Hero Honda Chowk flyover on the Delhi-Gurugram Expressway will be closed for traffic from September 21 to 26. During this period, commuters going towards Delhi will have to use the NH-48. According to the Gurugram Traffic Police, the lane is being closed to check the status of repair works carried out on the carriageway.

255.title: BJP MLA booked for harassing woman, son for rape: Agra Police
255.article_body: BJP MLA Chotte Lal Verma has been booked for allegedly harassing a woman and his son for allegedly raping her, Agra Police said. MLA has not been accused of rape, police added. The woman claimed that the MLA's son married her in a temple and forced her to abort three times for want of a male child, police further said.

256.title: SpiceJet stock falls 3% after airline sends 80 pilots on unpaid leave
256.article_body: Shares of SpiceJet traded over 3% lower at ₹41.9 apiece at 9:18 am on the BSE on Wednesday after the airline asked 80 of its pilots to go on a three-month leave without pay as a temporary measure to rationalise cost. The pilots, who have been forced to go on leave, are from the Gurugram-headquartered airline's Boeing and Bombardier fleet.

257.title: RBI approves R Gandhi as part-time Chairman of Yes Bank
257.article_body: The RBI has approved the appointment of its Former Deputy Governor, Rama Subramaniam Gandhi, as Non-Executive (Part-Time) Chairman of Yes Bank for three years, a regulatory filing said. Gandhi had a three-year secondment to the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI). He is a financial sector policy advisor who worked with investors and fintech companies.

258.title: Pak PM accused of treason for consulting Nawaz Sharif over new Army chief
258.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has been accused of committing treason for consulting his 'fugitive' elder brother and ex-PM Nawaz Sharif on the appointment of the new Army chief. A resolution was passed by the Punjab state assembly in this regard, seeking action against the PM. Shehbaz had met his brother while he was in London for Queen Elizabeth II's funeral.

259.title: Owaisi asks why is Jamia Masjid shut, Srinagar Police says it's not
259.article_body: After AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi asked Jammu & Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha why Srinagar's Jamia Masjid is shut every Friday, the police refuted the claim saying it is fully open. It was closed only on three occasions post-COVID, owing to inputs of terror attack and law and order situation, tweeted Srinagar Police. "Staying far is no excuse of ignorance," it added.

260.title: Yes Bank approves sale of its ₹48,000-crore bad loans to JC Flowers ARC
260.article_body: Yes Bank said its board has approved the transfer of stressed assets worth ₹48,000 crore to JC Flowers Asset Reconstruction after receiving no bids to challenge what was made by the private equity company. While JC Flowers submitted an initial bid of ₹11,183 crore for the NPA, it's said to be the largest sale of stressed assets in domestic markets.

261.title: Comedian Raju Srivastava passes away aged 58
261.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava has passed away in Delhi at the age of 58, his family confirmed. He was admitted to All India Institute Of Medical Sciences in Delhi on August 10 after experiencing chest pain and collapsing while working out at a gym. Srivastava had underwent angioplasty and was put on a ventilator.

262.title: MP minister writes to Anurag Thakur, seeks ban on Ajay Devgn's film 'Thank God'
262.article_body: Madhya Pradesh minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang has written to Union Minister of Information and Broadcasting Anurag Thakur, seeking a ban on Ajay Devgn and Sidharth Malhotra's upcoming film 'Thank God'. Sarang said that the film depicted Hindu gods inappropriately. An official statement from the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting is awaited, ANI reported.

263.title: Mumbai sees 62% surge in Malaria cases, dengue cases rise by 16%
263.article_body: Mumbai witnessed a 62% surge in Malaria cases, followed by 16% rise in dengue cases in the last week alone. Between September 12 and 18, Malaria cases increased to 191 as compared to 118 a week ago, whereas dengue cases jumped from 51 to 59 during the same period, a report stated. Experts have urged citizens to refrain from self-medicating.

264.title: Bystanders were taking videos instead of helping: Noida wall collapse eyewitness
264.article_body: An eyewitness to Noida's Sector 21 wall collapse incident, in which four labourers were killed, said that those standing near the drain were busy shooting videos even as they watched a few trying to help workers trapped under the debris. There were 12 people hired to clean and repair the drain when the wall collapsed on them, officials said.

265.title: Shinde is my guru: Pune man arrested for posing as CM
265.article_body: Vijay Nandkumar Mane, the man from Pune who was arrested for posing as Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, expressed regret if his actions caused trouble to the CM. "CM Shinde is my guru and I have great respect for him," said Mane. Dressed up like Shinde, Mane was clicked with a gangster, which led to a controversy.

266.title: Adani Group pledges stake worth $13 bn in newly acquired ACC, Ambuja Cements
266.article_body: Adani Group has pledged shares valued at about $13 billion in Ambuja Cements and ACC, days after it completed its acquisition from Holcim Group. Adani Group’s stakes in the two companies, about 57% in ACC and 63% in Ambuja Cements, have been encumbered "for the benefit of certain lenders and other finance parties," as per stock filings.

267.title: India reports 4,510 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 46,216
267.article_body: India reported 4,510 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 5,640 people recovered in the last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 46,216. The death toll has risen to 5,28,403, while daily positivity rate stands at 1.33%, as per data.

268.title: Tata firm TRF's shares surge 100% in 6 days, trade at 6-year high
268.article_body: Tata Group firm TRF Limited's shares surged over 100% in six consecutive sessions on Tuesday amid higher volumes with the stock hitting over six-year highs of ₹340.55 apiece on the NSE. CARE Ratings also revised TRF's long-term outlook rating from 'negative' to 'stable' after its promoter Tata Steel invested ₹165 crore in the company in June for working capital requirements.

269.title: Beyond Meat suspends COO after arrest in nose biting incident
269.article_body: Beyond Meat has suspended its COO Doug Ramsey effective immediately after reports of his arrest for allegedly biting a man's nose during a quarrel. Senior Vice President of manufacturing operations, Jon Nelson, will be overseeing the operations activities on an interim basis. Ramsey was detained on Saturday on third-degree battery and threatening charges, court records showed.

270.title: Tried over 50 looks for my character: Trisha on 'Ponniyin Selvan'
270.article_body: Actress Trisha Krishnan said she tried over 50 looks for her character Kundavai in Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan'. "We tried over 50 looks for the film, and later shortlisted around 30 out of them. Later, we picked the best 10 looks from that list, from which Mani Ratnam sir decided what worked for his film," she said.

271.title: 'Rahul, Priyanka are like children to me', Cong leader clarifies her remark
271.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Pratibha Singh clarified that some parts of an interview which quoted her as saying, Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra don’t give time to senior Congress leaders, were misunderstood. She said many things in her statement were portrayed from different angle. "As an elderly person, I always feel Rahul...Priyanka are like children to me," she added.

272.title: American Express to hire nearly 1,500 tech staff by year-end
272.article_body: American Express Co. has said it is looking to hire around 1,500 people for its technology arm in roles such as software engineers and coders by year-end. Chief Information Officer Ravi Radhakrishnan said nearly 60% of the hires will be in US, a third in India and the rest in Europe. It has added around 3,600 tech employees this year.

273.title: University of North Bengal VC gets CBI custody till Sept 26 in SSC scam
273.article_body: A court has remanded the Vice-Chancellor (VC) of the University of North Bengal, Subires Bhattacharyya, to CBI custody till September 26 in connection with the School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam. Notably, he was earlier the chairman of the West Bengal School Service Commission. CBI claimed that Bhattacharyya was involved in the manipulation of scores of candidates.

274.title: Saw Anushka train for 'Chakda 'Xpress', she's finding it challenging: Virat
274.article_body: Indian cricketer Virat Kohli said he respects how Anushka Sharma has been training for 'Chakda 'Xpress'. The film stars Anushka as cricketer Jhulan Goswami, the former captain of India's national women's cricket team. "She is finding the process challenging. This is the first time she is doing such a thing, and that too by learning bowling," he added.

275.title: BBMP extends deadline of welfare schemes like free laptops, housing subsidy
275.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has extended the last date to apply for various welfare programmes under the municipal corporation from September 19 to October 19. The welfare schemes include subsidy of ₹5 lakh for house construction on own plots, free laptops for undergraduate and postgraduate students, smart sticks for blind persons, educational laptops for blind students, etc.

276.title: Delhi Police arrests 3 gang members for robbing ATMs across country
276.article_body: The Delhi Police's Special Cell arrested three members of a Mewat-based gang for robbing ATMs across the country. According to the DCP of Special Cell, the gang stole over ₹2.25 crore by breaking 25 ATMs in Delhi and seven other states including Rajasthan and Haryana. Police also recovered three firearms along with seven live bullets from the apprehended persons' vehicle.

277.title: Mumbai man steals cash, gold from neighbour's house, helps file FIR
277.article_body: A 29-year-old man from Mumbai allegedly stole ₹50,000 cash and a gold chain worth ₹30,000 from his neighbour's house. Pretending to help, the accused, Santosh Shinde, accompanied the victim to the police station to get a case registered. Shinde was later caught with the stolen cash and gold while trying to leave the city and subsequently arrested.

278.title: Pak man sets 12-yr-old son on fire for not doing homework; arrested
278.article_body: A Pakistani man has been arrested for allegedly killing his 12-year-old son by setting him on fire after sprinkling kerosene on him for not doing homework, local media reported. The accused told police he had poured kerosene and lit a match to terrify his son into completing his homework, but the flame ignited the oil and set the child ablaze.

279.title: Man acquitted in Delhi riots case over officer's contradictory statement
279.article_body: A court on Tuesday acquitted a man in a February 2020 Northeast Delhi riots case. "The Investigating Officer (IO) contradicted his own statement regarding getting information prior to April 2, 2020, of the relevant witness," the court said. The identification of the accused on April 2, 2020, was probably an outcome of an afterthought development, it added.

280.title: Ford stock suffers worst day since 2011, sheds $7 billion in market value
280.article_body: Ford Motor's stock suffered its worst day in over 11 years after it said inflation-related costs would be $1 billion more than expected in the current quarter. While $7 billion was wiped off from its market value, the stock closed at $13.09 apiece on Tuesday, down by 12.3%. In January 2011, the stock had shed 13.4% to close at $16.27/share.

281.title: Huge protest breaks out at Punjab's Lovely Professional University over student's suicide
281.article_body: Students at Lovely Professional University (LPU) in Jalandhar held a massive protest on Tuesday night after a first-year student of Bachelor of Design allegedly died by suicide. Police said they recovered a note in which the 21-year-old student mentioned personal reasons for taking the extreme step. The university said it is providing full support to the authorities for further investigation.

282.title: Nikki Haley responds after US host calls her 'chameleon' for not using Indian name
282.article_body: Former US ambassador to UN Nikki Haley has responded after a US chat show host criticised her for not going by her first name. Sunny Hostin labeled Haley a "chameleon" for not embracing her ethnicity. Haley, whose first name is Nimrata, has gone by her middle name, Nikki, since childhood. Haley called Hostin "racist" for her "hypocrisy towards conservative minorities".

283.title: Don't want anything for myself, only interested in uniting Oppn: Nitish Kumar
283.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said he is only interested in uniting Opposition parties ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. His statement came as he dismissed speculations over his candidature in Lok Sabha polls from Uttar Pradesh. "I don't want anything for myself...whatever I am doing, it is for the younger generation...for people like Tejashwi Yadav," Kumar said.

284.title: Biggest threat to mainstream media is mainstream channels: Anurag Thakur
284.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that in his personal opinion, the "biggest threat" to mainstream media is not from the new-age digital platforms but rather the mainstream media channels. "If you decide to invite guests who are polarising, who spread false narratives, who shout at the top of their lungs, the credibility of your channels go down," Thakur added.

285.title: Labourer arrested for stealing ambulance from Hyd's Gandhi Hospital
285.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested a man, who worked as a labourer, for allegedly stealing an ambulance from Gandhi Hospital while the ambulance driver was occupied moving a patient to a ward. The accused K Yadagiri saw that the ambulance driver left the keys in the ambulance and later drove off with the vehicle, the police said.

286.title: Twitter to depose Elon Musk next week in $44 billion buyout case
286.article_body: Twitter will question Elon Musk under oath in Delaware next week as part of its lawsuit against the Tesla CEO over their $44 billion buyout deal. The deposition, scheduled to begin on September 26, could last up to three days. Twitter will also question Musk's aide Jared Birchall and lawyer Alex Spiro in the coming days, court filings showed.

287.title: 52-yr-old Pune auditor dies by suicide, 4 private moneylenders arrested
287.article_body: A 52-year-old auditor allegedly died by suicide in Pune following which four private moneylenders were arrested on the charge of abetment to suicide, police said. "We've recovered a suicide note...points to harassment by moneylenders from whom [the victim] had borrowed money," police added. The auditor, working for the State Cooperative Department, allegedly ended his life by hanging.

288.title: Gap to cut 500 corporate jobs in US & Asia amid declining sales
288.article_body: Clothing company Gap will cut 500 corporate jobs in San Francisco, New York and Asia as it looks to reduce expenses amid falling sales. Sales at the company, which also owns Banana Republic and Old Navy, are down roughly 10% from a year ago. Gap is eliminating positions that are open across several departments and has started notifying some employees.

289.title: Domestic help steals from Mumbai man to have luxurious life; arrested
289.article_body: A 20-year-old domestic help was arrested for allegedly stealing cash and valuables worth ₹3.23 lakh from her employer in Mumbai. She was hired six years ago by her employer, an elderly, to take care of his ill wife. According to police, she confessed to her crime, saying she wanted to marry her boyfriend and live a luxurious life.

290.title: Pune man booked for firing in the air during dispute over land
290.article_body: A man from Pune's Vimantal area was booked for firing one round in the air with his revolver during a dispute over land ownership, said police on Tuesday. The man was visiting the site where he had recently bought land when some persons came and allegedly attacked him, according to police. His revolver's licence had expired, added police.

291.title: Hero Vired offers accelerator prog. in Business Analytics & Data Science
291.article_body: Hero Vired has launched an accelerator program in Business Analytics & Data Science with placement assurance. The program is designed to help newcomers & those without a background in tech to kickstart their careers in data analytics and help them make data-driven business decisions, the company stated. It explores concepts & techniques of data analytics, predictive modelling & data visualization.

292.title: Wipro's slab on stormwater drain removed amid BBMP's demolition drive
292.article_body: A 2.4-metre concrete slab built on a stormwater drain within Wipro's campus in Bengaluru was completely removed on Tuesday as BBMP is carrying out an anti-encroachment drive in Mahadevapura zone. Last week, the civic authority released a list of high-profile encroachers which also included Wipro's name. However, the IT company said that the construction was done as per sanctioned plan.

293.title: David Warner shares Finch-Kohli's pic, apologises to fan after he says Rohit is captain
293.article_body: Australia opener David Warner took to Instagram to share a picture of Aaron Finch and Virat Kohli ahead of first India-Australia T20I and asked his followers about who'll win the match. An Indian fan reminded Warner that Rohit Sharma is India captain and not Kohli, suggesting him to change the picture. Warner apologised to the fan, saying, "I know sorry."

294.title: PM Modi was right when he said the time is not for war: French President Macron
294.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was right when he said the time is not for war, French President Emmanuel Macron said at the United Nations General Assembly on Tuesday. PM Modi told Russian President Vladimir Putin, "Today's era is not of war...Today we will get the opportunity to talk about how we can progress on the path of peace."

295.title: 20-yr-old student jumps off college building in Delhi, dies; note found
295.article_body: A 20-year-old second-year BA student allegedly killed herself by jumping off the college building in Delhi's Kamla Market, police said. A suicide note was recovered from one of her pockets in which she did not blame anybody, police added. The student belonged to Haryana, DCP (central) Shweta Chauhan said. Inquest proceedings under CrPC Section 174 have been initiated, police stated.

296.title: Mumbai's Lalbaugcha Raja Mandal fined over ₹3 lakh for digging up road
296.article_body: The BMC has issued a notice to the Lalbaugcha Raja Ganeshotsav Mandal in Mumbai, asking organisers to pay a fine of ₹3.66 lakh for apparently digging up the road. An inspection carried out after the festivities found 53 holes on the footpath and 130 pits on the road. However, Lalbaugcha Raja Committee President has denied receiving any notice yet.

297.title: 4 killed as speeding truck runs over people sleeping on road divider in Delhi
297.article_body: As many as four persons died in Delhi as a speeding truck ran over people sleeping on a road divider. "An unknown speeding truck mowed down four people...injured two persons...while crossing DTC Depot Redlight in Seemapuri," police said. The accident took place at 1:51 am, following which two persons died on the spot and one was declared brought dead.

298.title: Every country should do what PM Modi did: US on what PM Modi told Putin over Ukraine war
298.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi told Russian President Vladimir Putin that this is not the time for war in Ukraine, US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said, "We would like to see every country in the world making that case." "They can do it publicly if they like. They can do it privately if they like," he further said.

299.title: Virat Kohli's 'silent stare' pic from 1st T20I against Australia goes viral
299.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli's 'silent stare' picture from the first T20I against Australia has gone viral. Kohli's reaction came after Australia's Cameron Green slammed fours on the first two deliveries of their second over. "Every Indian fan's reaction," a fan commented. "I can see that Virat Kohli look becoming a meme," commentator Ian Bishop tweeted.

300.title: 35 firms applied for specialty steel under PLI scheme: Scindia
300.article_body: Union Steel Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said that as many as 35 firms had submitted 79 applications for specialty steel under the PLI (Production Linked Incentive) scheme. He added that the government planned to take specialty steel capacity to 28 million tonnes per annum (MTPA). A senior ministry official said the government would take around 35-40 days to shortlist applications.

301.title: SpiceJet sends 80 pilots on leave without pay for 3 months to cut costs
301.article_body: SpiceJet has asked 80 of its pilots to go on a three-month leave without pay as a temporary measure to rationalise costs. The pilots forced to go on leave without pay are from the airline's Boeing and Bombardier fleets. Meanwhile, a pilot said, "There's no assurance if those forced to go on leave will even be called back."

302.title: Bhagavad Gita not a religious book: Karnataka Education Minister
302.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said that the government will introduce the Bhagavad Gita in state-run schools from December. He added that the Gita was 'not a religious book' as it did not promote any religious practices as the Quran did. Nagesh further said that the Gita was a moral book and that it inspires students.

303.title: Hero MotoCorp partners with HPCL to install EV charging stations in India
303.article_body: Two-wheeler maker Hero MotoCorp has partnered with Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL) to establish charging infrastructure for EVs in India. A statement by the companies said they would start by establishing charging infrastructure at HPCL's existing energy station network. Each charging station will feature multiple smart and fast DC and AC chargers for all two-wheeled EVs.

304.title: Decorum, discipline are heart and soul of democracy: VP Dhankhar
304.article_body: Vice President (VP) Jagdeep Dhankhar, while addressing Rajasthan Legislative Assembly members, said decorum and discipline are the heart and soul of democracy. He added that the reputations of elected representatives and the efficiency of parliamentary institutions were critical for democracy. Further, he also said that political parties needed to come together and resolve their differences.

305.title: Interpol unveils Delhi General Assembly logo featuring Konark wheel
305.article_body: The Interpol on Tuesday unveiled its logo for the 90th Interpol General Assembly, featuring the chariot wheel of Odisha's famous Konark Temple. Reacting to it, Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik said, "Filled with pride that Interpol has unveiled the logo...inspired by the intricately carved chariot wheels of Konark Temple." He further thanked the CBI for including the wheel in the design.

306.title: Paddy procurement in Punjab to begin from Oct 1: Bhagwant Mann
306.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said that paddy procurement in the state will commence from October 1. "This time around 191 lakh metric tonnes of paddy is likely to come...Govt is committed to procuring every single grain of the crop," Mann said in a tweet. He also said that he reviewed the procurement arrangements.

307.title: Essar to invest $4 billion to set up steel plant in Saudi Arabia
307.article_body: Essar is planning to invest $4 billion to set up an integrated flat steelworks plant in Saudi Arabia, Amar Kapadia, a senior official at Essar, said. He added, "We have formally applied to the Saudi Industrial Development Fund (SIDF) [for evaluation]." The four-million tonnes per annum integrated plant will be completed by the end of 2025.

308.title: Former Kerala MLA & Congress leader K Mohammed passes away aged 76
308.article_body: Former Kerala MLA K Mohammed Ali passed away at a hospital in Kochi on Tuesday at the age of 76. The veteran Congress leader was under treatment for kidney-related ailments. Ali, who had entered mainstream politics through Congress' students' wing Kerala Students Union, won the Assembly polls consecutively from 1980-2006 and represented the Aluva constituency in the House six times.

309.title: Clarify stand on compensation for gas tragedy victims: SC to govt
309.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday asked the Centre whether it will go ahead with a curative petition which seeks additional compensation for the 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy victims. The petition seeks an additional ₹7,844 crore from the successor firms of US-based Union Carbide Corporation. The gas leak had killed over 3,000 people and affected over 1 lakh people.

310.title: India, France and UAE hold 1st trilateral ministerial meet
310.article_body: The first India-UAE-France trilateral ministerial meet was held in New York on Monday. After meeting UAE Foreign Minister Sheikh Abdullah bin Zayed Al Nahyan and French Minister Catherine Colonna, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the meeting was an "active exchange of ideas between strategic partners". Jaishankar is presently in New York to attend a UN General Assembly session.

311.title: Delhi records 81 new COVID-19 cases, one fatality
311.article_body: Delhi on Tuesday reported 81 fresh cases of COVID-19 and one death due to the infection, according to data shared by the city health department. The national capital's active case count stood at 463, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin. With the new cases logged on Tuesday, Delhi's total case tally climbed to 20,02,572.

312.title: Hijab is like pallu, even Indian Prez wears pallu: JDS K'taka Prez
312.article_body: JDS leader CM Ibrahim likened the hijab and the pallu over the head. Calling it an Indian tradition, he asked, "President of India takes pallu over her head, Indira Gandhi took pallu, is it PFI's doing?" The Karnataka government alleged before the Supreme Court that the hijab row was instigated by the Popular Front of India (PFI).

313.title: Very nice to hear: Ponting on Kohli acknowledging Anushka's support after scoring 71st ton
313.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli acknowledging Anushka Sharma's support after scoring his 71st international hundred, Ricky Ponting said, "He...spoke very fondly about his wife's influence on...last couple of years of his life...which is also very nice to hear." Ponting added, "A lot of that stuff goes unspoken about, in men's sport in particular."

314.title: Lioness kills 15-year-old boy in Gujarat's Amreli
314.article_body: A 15-year-old boy was killed in an attack by a lioness at Vavdi village in Gujarat's Amreli district on Tuesday. The deceased, Rahul Meswaniya, was attacked when he was passing through an isolated patch of a road on the outskirts of the village, an official said. Notably, cages were being set up to trap the lioness, the official added.

315.title: Best woman Agnipath Navy inductee to get General Bipin Rawat Award
315.article_body: The best woman inductee in the Navy under the Agnipath scheme would be given the General Bipin Rawat Award, Navy chief Admiral R Hari Kumar said on Tuesday. The scheme began taking shape when General Rawat was the Chief of Defence Staff, he added. The Admiral stated that he and others in the armed forces were fully behind the scheme.

316.title: US and Canadian naval vessels sail through the Taiwan Strait
316.article_body: A US Navy warship and a Canadian frigate sailed through the Taiwan Strait as part of a routine transit on Tuesday, the US military said. The transit was carried out through a corridor beyond the territorial waters of any country, it added. Notably, China has protested the passage of western naval vessels through the strait in recent years.

317.title: Survey of madrasas begins in Kanpur
317.article_body: The survey of madrasas has started in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur, Sub Divisional Magistrate Himanshu Nagpal said. "We are checking certain points such as land records, syllabus, cleanliness [and] housing facilities," he added. According to the state government's order, the survey will be on the basis of 12 aspects. The teams for the survey have been constituted by the District Magistrate.

318.title: Adam Levine issues statement after being accused of cheating, says 'I crossed the line'
318.article_body: 'Maroon 5' singer Adam Levine responded after Instagram model Sumner Stroh accused him of cheating on his wife Behati Prinsloo. "I used poor judgment in speaking with anyone other than my wife in any kind of flirtatious manner. I didn't have an affair, nevertheless, I crossed the line," he said. Sumner had shared alleged DMs sent to her by Levine.

319.title: Rohit jokingly grabs Karthik's head and jaw after review, pic goes viral
319.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma jokingly grabbed Dinesh Karthik's head and jaw after a successful review that resulted in Australia's Glenn Maxwell's wicket in the first T20I in Mohali. This came after Karthik made a half-hearted appeal after taking Maxwell's catch and Rohit appeared to tell him to appeal in such situations. The umpire had originally declared Maxwell not out.

320.title: Canadian PM criticised for singing at hotel 2 days before Queen's funeral, responds
320.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau faced backlash from some people over a video of him singing 'Bohemian Rhapsody' at a London hotel, two days before Queen Elizabeth II's funeral. Critics called Trudeau singing during Canada's 10-day period of mourning "inappropriate". Trudeau's office responded, "Over the past 10 days, the PM has taken part in various activities to pay...respects to the Queen."

321.title: Old Pension Scheme to be implemented if AAP wins Gujarat: Kejriwal
321.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal guaranteed government employees in Gujarat that if the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) wins elections in the state, then the Old Pension Scheme (OPS) would be implemented. Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has issued an order considering the implementation of the scheme in the AAP-ruled state, Kejriwal added. He urged state government employees to dethrone BJP government in Gujarat.

322.title: Secure release of TN fishermen arrested by Sri Lankan Navy: CM to Centre
322.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Tuesday urged External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar to secure the release of fishermen arrested by the Sri Lankan Navy. The Sri Lankan Navy arrested eight fishermen belonging to Pudukkottai today and seized their mechanised boats, Stalin said in his letter. Over 95 fishing boats and 11 fishermen are still in their custody, he added.

323.title: 'Yuvraj Singh Stand', 'Harbhajan Singh Stand' inaugurated at Mohali stadium, pics surface
323.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann inaugurated the 'Yuvraj Singh Stand' and 'Harbhajan Singh Stand' at Punjab Cricket Association Stadium in Mohali on Tuesday. "It's a nice feeling to be back at PCA Stadium like this. I'm wearing...BCCI blazer at my own stadium for the first time. It feels wonderful to be called by my ex-parent association and get acknowledged," Yuvraj said.

324.title: Will vote for those who accept Nehru family: Kerala MP on Congress polls
324.article_body: Kerala Congress senior leader K Muraleedharan said that the state party would vote for only those who recognise the prominence of the Nehru family for the post of Congress chief. He also added that there was no dispute regarding Rahul Gandhi taking the post. Congress is likely to see a contest for the post of party chief after two decades.

325.title: Useless talk: Bihar CM on claims of him fighting LS polls from UP
325.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar termed reports of him contesting the 2024 Lok Sabha (LS) elections from UP as "bekaar baat" (useless talk). "My only interest is to unite as many parties as possible...That will be a big achievement," said Kumar. JD(U) President Lalan Singh had said that Kumar was offered three LS seats in UP to choose from for 2024.

326.title: Russian State Duma okays tougher punishment for deserting soldiers
326.article_body: The Russian State Duma on Tuesday approved a bill which seeks to toughen punishments for soldiers who surrender to the enemy or desert a military unit. According to the bill, deserting a military unit during martial law would attract up to 10 years in jail. Under the present law, desertion by a soldier will attract a sentence of five years.

327.title: Queen Elizabeth II entranced Federer at Wimbledon in 2010: Virginia Wade
327.article_body: Recalling how Queen Elizabeth II left Roger Federer "entranced" when they had lunch together at Wimbledon in 2010, ex-British tennis player Virginia Wade said, "We all had this really in-depth, diverse conversation...She knew all about Roger." She added, "Roger was on...Queen's right and I was on the left. Everybody had big eyes." Queen Elizabeth II died on September 8.

328.title: Real journalism is presenting truth, letting all present their views: Thakur
328.article_body: Union Minister for Information and Broadcasting Anurag Thakur said that the "biggest threat to mainstream media is not from new age digital platforms, but rather the mainstream media channel itself". "Real journalism is about...presenting the truth and letting all sides [on] the platform present their views," Thakur said. He also remarked on media channels inviting "polarising" guests.

329.title: Minor Dalit girl abducted, raped for 2 days in J'khand; probe on
329.article_body: A minor Dalit girl in Jharkhand's Garhwa was allegedly kidnapped on September 6 when she went out to urinate and was raped for two days. On the third day, the accused left the house after threatening the girl of killing her family if she revealed anything about the crime to anyone. The victim's family registered a case on September 18.

330.title: 3 killed during protests over Mahsa Amini's death: Iranian official
330.article_body: Three people have been killed in Iran's Kurdistan province during protests over the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, the region's governor said on Tuesday. He claimed that the three were killed as part of "a plot by the enemy", Iran's semi-official Fars news agency reported. Mahsa Amini died last week after allegedly being assaulted by police over "improper hijab".

331.title: Floods kill over 300 people in Nigeria, over 1 lakh displaced
331.article_body: Floods have killed more than 300 people in Nigeria this year, officials have told the Associated Press. The Nigeria National Emergency Management Agency said the floods have affected about 5,00,000 people and displaced over 1,00,000 people in 27 of the country's 36 states. The floods have also injured over 500 people, it added.

332.title: Gujarat state health workers start protest, list 14 demands
332.article_body: Employees of the Gujarat state government's Tuberculosis Control Programme have started a protest and have released a list of 14 demands, which include salary hikes and permanent employment for contractual employees. Around 1,100 employees went on mass leave on Monday, announcing an indefinite strike. The protesting personnel include treatment supervisors, laboratory supervisors and accountants.

333.title: Russia banned by UEFA from Euro 2024 qualification draw
333.article_body: The Russian Football Union and UEFA have both said that the country will not take part in the draw for Euro 2024 qualification. The Russian national team and Russian clubs were banned from international competitions by UEFA following the invasion of Ukraine. Russia had filed an appeal in the Court of Arbitration for Sport but the appeal was rejected.

334.title: Convinced Kapil Dev to retire after world record: Ex-India selector
334.article_body: Former India selector Anshuman Gaekwad has revealed that the BCCI had to convince Kapil Dev to retire after the ex-India captain claimed he could play for two more years. Gaekwad said they "allowed" Dev to play the 1994 Sri Lanka series so that he could become the highest Test wicket-taker. The ex-selector added that Dev took the advice with grace.

335.title: German gas storage facilities over 90% full: AGSI
335.article_body: Germany's gas storage facilities are more than 90% full, said European energy data platform Aggregated Gas Storage Inventory (AGSI). The German government has recently focused on energy security, as Russian gas imports via the Nord pipeline have stopped amidst the Ukraine war. The German government plans to fill its storage capacity to 95% by November ahead of the winter months.

336.title: Air ambulance facility soon from AIIMS Rishikesh: Scindia
336.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said that the air ambulance facility is soon going to be operational from AIIMS Rishikesh. "Request for proposal will be invited in the next couple of weeks for AIIMS Rishikesh so that helicopters are pushed into service to save precious time and lives," said Scindia at the 49th national convention of AIMA.

337.title: Sunil Chhetri, Gurpreet Sandhu highest-ranked India players on FIFA 23
337.article_body: EA Sports' FIFA 23 game has ranked captain Sunil Chhetri its highest rated Indian player with a score of 68. Goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu is second with a rating of 64 as Amrinder Singh, Pritam Kotal and Arindam Bhattacharya make up the top five with a 63 rating. EA introduced Indian players and ISL teams in its FIFA 22 iteration.

338.title: Rajnath Singh meets Egyptian President El-Sisi in Cairo
338.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh met Egyptian President Abdel Fattah El-Sisi in Cairo as part of his three-day visit to the Arab country. "Privileged to call on the President...India and Egypt continue to work on enhancing mutual trust and confidence,” Rajnath tweeted. Later, Rajnath met Egypt's Defence Minister General Mohamed Zaki and discussed expanding cooperation in the defence sector.

339.title: All the sharks came on the show to get famous: Ashneer Grover on 'Shark Tank'
339.article_body: In a recent interview, Shark Tank India's Ashneer Grover said, "[All the sharks will make] tall claims about different reasons why they did the show. I'll tell you...all the sharks came on the show to get famous." He added all the sharks shouldn't hesitate in saying they came for fame, adding, "Why are you bringing...nation and entrepreneurship into it?"

340.title: Once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be in same team as Roger, Rafael, Andy: Novak
340.article_body: Speaking about being in the same team as three of his biggest rivals, Rafael Nadal, Roger Federer and Andy Murray, at Laver Cup, Novak Djokovic stated it's probably a "once-in-a-lifetime" opportunity. "Great to be here, exciting, full of emotional moments on and off the court, particularly for Roger," he added. All four will play for Team Europe in London.

341.title: S Jaishankar meets Indonesian counterpart in New York
341.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Indonesian Foreign Minister Retno Marsudi in New York as they discussed Jakarta's term as G20 President and the situation in Myanmar. Jaishankar is presently in New York to attend a UN General Assembly session and on the sidelines, he is meeting foreign leaders. India will assume the G-20 Presidency in December this year.

342.title: RBI removes Central Bank of India from PCA list
342.article_body: RBI on Tuesday said that it has removed the Central Bank of India from the Prompt Corrective Action Framework list. The bank was no longer in breach of PCA parameters as per its 2021-22 results, RBI said. The bank committed that it'd comply with norms of minimum regulatory capital, net NPA and leverage ratio on an ongoing basis, it added.

343.title: Australia record their highest-ever successful chase against India in T20I cricket
343.article_body: Australia defeated India by four wickets in the first T20I in Mohali on Tuesday. Australia recorded their highest successful T20I run chase against India by chasing down a 209-run target. Australia's previous highest successful T20I chase against India had come on February 27, 2019, when they chased down a 191-run target.

344.title: Bride walks on road full of potholes for photoshoot in Kerala, pics go viral
344.article_body: A bride and a wedding photographer from Kerala have done a photoshoot on a road full of potholes to highlight the issue of potholes in the area. Shared by Arrow Wedding Company, a clip shows her dressed in traditional wedding attire and jewellery as she walks across a road with potholes. The clip has amassed more than 4 million views.

345.title: MP Sanjay Raut prima facie recipient of proceeds of crime: Court
345.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut prima facie appears to be the recipient of proceeds of crime to the tune of ₹1.06 crore, a special court said in its order. The court was taking cognisance of the supplementary chargesheet filed against Raut by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) last week. Raut was arrested by the ED on August 1.

346.title: Kashmir Files maker Vivek congratulates Chhello Show team for Oscars entry
346.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri took to Twitter on Tuesday to congratulate the team of 'Chhello Show' after it was announced that the Gujarati film would be India's contender for the 2023 Oscars. "Wishing them the best film award at the #Oscars2023," he wrote. "I thank all the well-wishers and [especially] media which was rooting for #TheKashmirFiles," Vivek added.

347.title: There's need to start 'Bharatiya' education system: Arvind Kejriwal
347.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal called for a "Bharatiya" or indigenous education system in place of the one inherited from the British. "Not just NCERT books but the entire content needs to be changed," said Kejriwal. He added that despite having the best engineers and doctors, "it is a matter of shame" that Indians go to Ukraine to study medicine.

348.title: Iranian Supreme Leader's aide visits family of Mahsa Amini
