348.article_body: An aide to Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei paid a visit to the family of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini who died last week after allegedly being assaulted by police over "improper hijab", state media reported on Tuesday. Abdolreza Pourzahabi, Khamenei's representative in the Kurdistan province, also ensured Amini's family that their rights would not be ignored, media reports said.

349.title: Kashmir Files, RRR were nowhere in front of Chhello Show: FFI President
349.article_body: Film Federation of India (FFI) President producer TP Aggarwal has revealed that the Gujarati film 'Chhello Show (Last Film Show)' was "unanimously" chosen as India's official entry for Oscars 2023 by the jury. "'The Kashmir Files' and 'RRR' were nowhere in front of this...They said there was no second or third film," the FFI President added.

350.title: Actor Salman Khan to take pay cut for 'Bigg Boss 16': Report
350.article_body: Actor Salman Khan will reportedly be taking a pay cut for 'Bigg Boss 16'. This comes after Mid-Day reported that the upcoming season will have reduced sponsors as last year's 'Bigg Boss OTT' did not meet expected revenue targets. 'Bigg Boss OTT' was hosted by filmmaker Karan Johar and actress Divya Agarwal had won the show.

351.title: 'I'm TMC leader, I'll kill you,' reads letter sent to Sushil Modi
351.article_body: Former Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Modi has alleged that a letter was sent to his residence in Patna from Bengal last month. The purported letter, shared by the BJP MP online, read, "I am [a TMC leader]...Mamata Banerjee could be the next PM...You are the pet dog of [PM] Narendra Modi...I will kill you on or before [August 31, 2022]."

352.title: OYO to get 'green tag' for eco-friendly hotels on its platform: CEO
352.article_body: OYO India CEO Ankit Gupta said that the company is working on getting a 'green tag' for sustainable and eco-friendly hotels on its platform. The 'green tag' will be given to hotels that have features such as solar powered lighting and rainwater harvesting. Recently, OYO filed financial documents with SEBI and reported EBITDA profit of ₹10.6 crore for June quarter.

353.title: Kohli gets out to Zampa because of overconfidence: Virat's childhood coach
353.article_body: Former Indian skipper Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has commented on the former's record of getting dismissed to Australian spinner Adam Zampa on seven occasions in white-ball cricket. "I feel Kohli has always been dismissed to Zampa because of his overconfidence...Sometimes Kohli has tried to plunder him (Zampa) for runs and has ended up losing his wicket," Sharma said.

354.title: Mizoram and Assam CMs to meet tomorrow to work out border dispute
354.article_body: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga and Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma will be meeting in Delhi on Wednesday to find a solution to the border dispute between the states. The CMs last met in November for talks. The dispute between the states turned violent in July 2021, leading to the death of six policemen and an Assamese civilian.

355.title: Fossil eggs suggest dinosaurs were in decline even before asteroid impact
355.article_body: A study of the fossilised eggs unearthed in China stated that dinosaurs were in decline even before the large asteroid hit the Earth 66 million years ago. Researchers assessed 1,000 eggs and eggshells and found that dinosaurs were not very diverse before their extinction. Global climate fluctuations and massive volcanic eruptions may have already led to their decline, researchers said.

356.title: 7 policemen conduct checks beyond their jurisdiction in MP; suspended
356.article_body: Seven police personnel at Moti Nagar police station in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar city have been suspended for allegedly conducting checks beyond their jurisdiction. The suspended policemen include the in-charge of the police station. "Prima facie, no seizure was reported by these police personnel," Sagar Superintendent of Police Tarun Nayak said.

357.title: Flemish church defies Vatican, allows blessing same-sex unions
357.article_body: Belgium's Flemish Roman Catholic Church on Tuesday issued a document effectively allowing the blessing of same-sex unions. Notably, the move is in direct defiance of the Vatican's doctrine that prohibits the blessing of such civil unions. The document published by the Flemish Church, however, stressed that same-sex unions are not "what the Church understands by a sacramental marriage".

358.title: I'm not a controversial filmmaker, I respect all communities: Ali Abbas
358.article_body: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar has said he's not a controversial filmmaker. "None of the films before my last outing (Tandav) has been controversial," he added. "I've respect for all communities and cultures. The beauty of Indian culture is we co-exist with a lot of love and mutual respect and I want to portray that in my films," said Ali.

359.title: What a brilliant way to end innings: Raina on Hardik's 71* in 1st T20I vs Aus
359.article_body: Following India all-rounder Hardik Pandya's unbeaten 71 runs off 30 balls in the first T20I against Australia, Suresh Raina said, "What a brilliant way to end the innings Hardik, congratulations on your half-century." He added, "Fantastic performance boys, let's win this." It is Hardik's second half-century in T20Is. India put up a total of 208/6 in 20 overs.

360.title: Many lessons can be learnt from Ukraine war: Indian Navy chief
360.article_body: Indian Navy chief Admiral Hari Kumar said there are "many lessons" to be learnt from the war between Ukraine and Russia. "Full-scale war apart, there could be the use of cyber warfare and other disruptive technologies," said Admiral Kumar. He added that there are three reasons to start a war: fear, honour and interest but ending it was more difficult.

361.title: India has potential to meet food requirement of world: Union Minister
361.article_body: Union Agriculture Minister Narendra Singh Tomar said India has the potential to become "Aatma Nirbhar" in agriculture and meet the food requirement of the world. "I use this opportunity to invite...international community to join hands with us for the benefit of coming generations," Tomar said. The country's agri exports have crossed the milestone of ₹4 lakh crore, he added.

362.title: Who's Sumner Stroh, the model who accused Maroon 5's Adam of cheating on his wife?
362.article_body: Sumner Stroh, the model who accused Maroon 5's Adam Levine of cheating on his pregnant wife Behati Prinsloo, is an Instagram influencer from Austin, Texas. The 23-year-old is a University of Texas graduate with a degree in Marketing and Advertisement. Sumner, currently the marketing manager of a jewellery brand, has reportedly worked as a media manager at Bumble.

363.title: Rahul Gandhi knows problems of poor, should be Cong Prez: Hanumantha Rao
363.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao said that he believes Rahul Gandhi would be the most suitable leader for the post of Congress President. "As Rahul Gandhi is touring across the country, he knows the problems of the poor. Rahul should be president of the Congress party," he said. "Rahul Gandhi's family gave their lives for the country," Rao added.

364.title: Push towards apostasy: Muslim groups on bhajan in J&K school
364.article_body: A group of religious organisations in Kashmir objected to the singing of a bhajan at a school in Kulgam calling it 'speeding' of the "integration of younger generation with the Hindutva idea of India". A representative Muslim body said the "enforcement" of singing Hindu hymns is a 'cause of great concern'. Another group called it a "deliberate plan" towards "apostasy".

365.title: Three IS terrorists planning bomb blasts arrested in Karnataka
365.article_body: Police in Karnataka's Shivamogga arrested three individuals for allegedly being members of and working to carry out Islamic State (IS) activities. "The gang members were in possession of explosives and planned to carry out blasts across the state," said the police. The police also reportedly claimed that the trio had undergone training to carry out blasts and other terrorist activities.

366.title: Ayushmann is back with what he does best: Bhumi on 'Doctor G'
366.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar took to her Instagram Stories to share the trailer of Ayushmann Khurrana's upcoming movie 'Doctor G'. "This looks insane guys...AK (Ayushmann Khurrana) is back with what he does best...What a cast. Can't wait to watch it," she wrote. 'Doctor G', directed by Anubhuti Kashyap, also stars Rakul Preet Singh and Shefali Shah.

367.title: Actress Ekta Sharma takes up job at call centre after not getting work on TV for 2 years
367.article_body: Actress Ekta Sharma has taken up a job at a call centre after she didn't get work on TV for two years. "I'm doing a respectable job...I'm proud of it," Ekta, who's also fighting a court case for her daughter's custody, said. "My only motive was...I wanted to live a life of a warrior, not a victim," Ekta added.

368.title: Carlsen applauds, flashes thumbs up to 17-yr-old Praggnanandhaa after their draw
368.article_body: World number one chess player Magnus Carlsen applauded and flashed a thumbs up to 17-year-old Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa after their match in the Julius Baer Generation tournament ended in a draw. "I didn't see it then. I just checked it [later]. It was a great fight, I think," Praggnanandhaa said about Carlsen's gesture and the match.

369.title: I'm definitely done, I know that: Federer rules out any sort of comeback
369.article_body: When asked if he too could "unretire" in the future as Serena Williams hinted, 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer said, "No, no. I'm definitely done. I know that." Twenty three-time Grand Slam champion Serena, who retired during US Open 2022, didn't rule out a future comeback. Federer announced last week that he'll retire after upcoming Laver Cup in London.

370.title: Opium traces from 14th century BC found in ancient grave in Israel
370.article_body: Traces of opium dating back to the 14th century BC were found in vessels possibly used in burial rituals in ancient graves in Israel. This marks one of the world's earliest evidences of use of opium. "During these ceremonies...participants attempted to raise...spirits of their dead relatives...to express a request, and would enter an ecstatic state by using opium," researchers said.

371.title: NASA to conduct cryogenic test for Artemis I to check hydrogen repair
371.article_body: NASA will perform a cryogenic demonstration test for Artemis I on September 21. Hydrogen leak between Space Launch System rocket and liquid hydrogen fuel feed line had delayed its launch earlier. The test will help in checking if the leak has been repaired properly. During the test, supercold liquid hydrogen and liquid oxygen will be loaded into the SLS rocket.

372.title: Ananya, Nushrratt approached for Ekta Kapoor's 'KTina': Report
372.article_body: Actresses Ananya Panday and Nushrratt Bharuccha have been approached for Ekta Kapoor's upcoming film titled 'KTina', according to a report. It will reportedly be directed by Raaj Shaandilyaa, the filmmaker who helmed 'Dream Girl'. "They (makers) will work on the shooting schedule and other logistics once the cast is locked," a source quoted by Pinkvilla said.

373.title: 'GOT' stunt coordinator to design action scenes for 'Bade...': Report
373.article_body: Hollywood stunt coordinator Paul Jennings will reportedly be designing the action sequence in Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff-starrer 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan'. Paul has worked in 'Batman Begins' and 'Game of Thrones'. "They are in the final stage of conversation with Paul and it should be formalised soon," a source close to the development stated.

374.title: RBI not interested in penalising fintechs, wants them to follow rules: Guv
374.article_body: RBI is not interested in penalising fintechs or stifling innovation but wants them to follow the rules of the game, Governor Shaktikanta Das said on Tuesday. "RBI will continue to be supportive of [digital lending] and will welcome it. We will, in fact, go two steps forward to discuss with you if you just take one step forward," Das added.

375.title: Isolation centre opened for cattle with lumpy skin disease in Udaipur
375.article_body: An isolation centre has been opened in Rajasthan's Udaipur for cattle suffering from lumpy skin disease. Animal Husbandry Department said the disease is spreading as healthy cattle are coming in contact with infected ones. Milk production in Rajasthan is estimated to have reduced by six to eight lakh litres per day due to the disease, said Rajasthan Cooperative Dairy Federation.

376.title: UP painter uses savings to make skeletal Brahmos missile designs
376.article_body: A painter from UP's Jaunpur has used his savings to make skeletal designs of the Brahmos missile and a helicopter. Painter Sarvesh says he wants "to make people aware of the sacrifice of defence personnel" and started the project two years ago. Sarvesh said he currently works as a labourer and tries to save money to put into pending work.

377.title: EPFO adds 18.23 lakh subscribers in July, posts 24% YoY rise
377.article_body: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) added 18.23 lakh net subscribers in July 2022, marking an increase of over 24% as compared to the year-ago period, Labour Ministry data showed. Of the total additions, around 10.58 lakh members joined EPFO's social security ambit for the first time. About 57.69% of the new subscribers are from the age-group of 18-25 years.

378.title: Hurts to see media pick up adverse global comments on India: Dhankhar
378.article_body: Vice-President (VP) Jagdeep Dhankhar said it "pains" his heart when the media picks up, in "high decibel", adverse comments made against India by someone disconnected from ground reality. "That kind of politics has to be contained," said Dhankhar. He added that India had never received so much global attention and the image of Indians abroad is a matter of pride.

379.title: Ambala court sentences man to 20 years in prison for raping minor
379.article_body: A man was handed a 20-year prison sentence by a fast track court in Haryana's Ambala on Tuesday for raping a 14-year-old girl. According to the prosecution, the convict came to the victim's house in April 2020 while her parents were away and gave her chocolate to eat, after which she fell asleep. The 24-year-old man then raped the minor.

380.title: Raj CM calls late-night meeting of Congress MLAs ahead of party's Prez polls
380.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has called a late-night meeting of Congress MLAs at 10 pm on Tuesday ahead of the party's Presidential polls. "Meeting's agenda isn't clear," a cabinet minister of Rajasthan government said. Gehlot, who is scheduled to travel to Kerala on Wednesday to join 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', is likely to file nomination for the polls between September 24-28.

381.title: Odisha college student beaten by brother for ignoring studies, dies
381.article_body: A 21-year-old college student in Odisha's Bhubaneswar was allegedly thrashed to death by his elder brother for neglecting his studies and leading a "lavish lifestyle", police said on Tuesday. The elder brother, who was reprimanding the student, picked up an iron pipe and beat him up when he didn't listen. The accused was arrested on Tuesday after police got information.

382.title: Film industry was praying for 'Brahmastra' to do well: Alia Bhatt
382.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that everyone in the film industry wanted her film 'Brahmastra' to do well at the box office. "I don't think I have ever gotten so many 'all the best' messages before a film...That spirit of the industry even before the release was very special to witness," she further added. The film also featured Ranbir Kapoor.

383.title: Argentina sees shortage of football WC stickers; fans call it 'frustrating'
383.article_body: The convenience stores in Argentina have reportedly run out of stocks of football World Cup stickers that have become quite popular among the citizens. According to Reuters, the craze has led to the creation of an app that allows fans to track the availability of stickers. "It's frustrating," a resident said as fresh stocks are getting sold out within hours.

384.title: Odisha woman falls off bike as saree gets entangled in wheel, dies
384.article_body: A woman fell off a moving motorbike after her saree got entangled in the rear wheel of the two-wheeler in Odisha on Tuesday. The woman, Geetanjali Rana, died due to severe head injuries. A man named Judhisthir Rana was driving the bike with his wife Santoshini and Geetanjali riding pillion when the accident happened. Judhisthir and Santoshini sustained critical injuries.

385.title: Fintech sector needs to work relentlessly on safety, reliability: PM
385.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said the fintech industry needs to work relentlessly on safety and reliability to uphold trust of the people. "Rapid, relentless and proactive work in ensuring security, safety and reliability is important to uphold the enormous trust that the people have placed," he said. PM Modi said this in his message at the Global Fintech Fest.

386.title: He frees his mind and strike rate is natural outcome: Harsha on Rahul's 55(35)
386.article_body: Commenting on India opener KL Rahul's strike rate of 157.14 during his 35-ball 55 in the first T20I against Australia in Mohali, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "So, you see, KL Rahul doesn't have to worry about, or think of, strike rates." He added, "He frees his mind and the strike rate is the natural outcome."

387.title: Didn't have a permanent house when I was growing up: Shefali Shah
387.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah revealed she did not have a permanent house while growing up as her father's job at RBI wasn't permanent yet. "There were times when he would request my uncle or someone to let me and my mom stay there," she stated. Shefali added she later lived in a 'kholi' in Mahim with her parents, uncle and aunt.

388.title: UPI aims to process 1 bn transactions a day in 5 years: Sitharaman
388.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said that Unified Payments Interface (UPI) has set a target to process one billion transactions a day in the next five years. She said the country is witnessing substantial growth in UPI transactions on monthly basis. Notably, about 6.28 billion UPI transactions worth over ₹10.62 lakh crore took place in July.

389.title: Violent protests in Bengal after child's body found in neighbour's house
389.article_body: People burnt a vehicle during a protest after the body of a missing child was reportedly recovered in his neighbour's house in West Bengal's Santiniketan. Police have detained the accused woman and appealed to villagers to maintain peace, the Birbhum Superintendent of Police said. The boy went missing on Sunday when he went to buy biscuits from a shop.

390.title: India record their highest-ever total against Australia in T20I cricket
390.article_body: India put up a total of 208/6 in their 20 overs against Australia in the first T20I today. It's India's highest total against Australia in T20I cricket. India's previous highest T20I total against Australia had come on October 10, 2013, when they registered 202/4. It's the third time India have aggregated a T20I total of 200 or more against Australia.

391.title: 25-yr-old Cong worker uploads pro-Pakistan post online, arrested
391.article_body: A 25-year-old Congress worker was arrested on Monday in the Laksar area of Haridwar for allegedly uploading a 'Pakistan Zindabad' poster on social media, police said on Tuesday. During questioning, the accused told the police that he had uploaded a poster and added the slogan by mistake, a police official said. A complaint was registered after the post went viral.

392.title: Ireland to increase state pension for those who work beyond 66
392.article_body: Ireland's cabinet has approved a reform in the country's pension scheme under which anyone choosing to work beyond the age of 66 will receive a higher state pension. From 2024, people will have the option to work until 70 years of age. For each year they work beyond 66, there will be an increment in their pension.

393.title: Belittled police: Ex-IPS officers to Prez on Kejriwal's Gujarat visit
393.article_body: Thirty former IPS officers have written a letter to President Droupadi Murmu, accusing Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of "belittling" police officers during his recent visit to Gujarat. While campaigning for the coming elections in the state, Kejriwal had refused police protection while he was on his way to an autorickshaw driver's home for dinner.

394.title: Raveena Tandon to star in Arbaaz Khan's film 'Patna Shukla'
394.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon has been roped in for a film titled 'Patna Shukla', which will be produced by Arbaaz Khan. Speaking about the film, Arbaaz said that the upcoming social drama has all the ingredients that the Indian audience wants to watch. He added that Raveena will be seen in a "never-seen-before avatar" in 'Patna Shukla'.

395.title: BJP, Cong united to abuse me: Kejriwal on 'Modi, Modi' chants in Guj
395.article_body: After being greeted with chants of 'Modi, Modi' at Gujarat's Vadodara Airport, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said that BJP and Congress are united in their aim to "abuse him". This is the reason why BJP supporters never yell anti-Rahul Gandhi slogans when the Congress leader visits Gujarat, he added. "With elections approaching…protests against...AAP are going to increase," Kejriwal stated.

396.title: Video of anchor mistaking Rahul Gandhi for KL Rahul on live TV goes viral
396.article_body: A video of an anchor mistaking Congress' Rahul Gandhi for Team India batter KL Rahul on live TV has gone viral on social media. In the video, the anchor can be heard saying, "India captain Rohit Sharma has said that Rahul Gandhi would open in T20 World Cup." Reacting to the video, a user commented, "Please fact check."

397.title: Birthday wishes to bowler who is still a mystery for many batters: Irfan to Rashid
397.article_body: Irfan Pathan took to Twitter to wish Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan on his 24th birthday and wrote, "Birthday wishes to the bowler who is still a mystery for many batters around the world. Rashid, have a good one brother." Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Enjoy your special day and have an amazing year ahead." Harbhajan Singh said, "Happy birthday Rashid, love always."

398.title: Power tariff revision won't affect the poor: TN CM Stalin
398.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Tuesday said the recent power tariff hike effected by the state government will not affect the poor. Electricity rates are still cheaper in Tamil Nadu compared to other states, Stalin said. He further blamed the previous AIADMK government's administrative negligence and debts of the state-run distribution company for the revision.

399.title: BharatPe could go public in 18-24 months: Chairman Rajnish Kumar
399.article_body: BharatPe Chairman Rajnish Kumar said the company could go public in the next 18-24 months. Speaking to CNBC-TV18, Kumar said that the company is working towards a few quarters of profitability for investor confidence in the company's plan. He added that the company's cash burn, which was $11 million per month, is down to a little above $2 million.

400.title: Uttara Kannada to get super-specialty hospital: K'taka Minister
400.article_body: Karnataka Minister of Health and Family Welfare K Sudhakar said CM Basavaraj Bommai has given approval for setting up a super-specialty hospital in Uttara Kannada district. "Location and other modalities regarding setting up the hospital will be discussed with the CM," he said. All aspects regarding healthcare infrastructure in the district were discussed with elected representatives, he added.

401.title: Uber asks India drivers to ensure rear seatbelts are functional
401.article_body: Uber asked drivers in India to ensure that rear seatbelts in their cars are functional. This comes amid a greater push for road safety, days after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry died in a car crash. "To avoid any fines or complaints by riders, please ensure the seatbelts on the back seats are accessible and functional," Uber said.

402.title: Mother Dairy expecting 20% revenue growth in FY23 to ₹15,000 cr: MD
402.article_body: Leading milk supplier Mother Dairy's MD Manish Bandlish has said the company is expecting 20% revenue growth in FY23 to about ₹15,000 crore. "We are witnessing strong demand for all...milk and...dairy products," Bandlish said. Mother Dairy's turnover stood at ₹12,500 crore in last fiscal year. Notably, the company had increased milk prices by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR in August.
